He values and appreciates the opportunity of the loan, and he promises to pay it on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish paying for a small piece of land that he is buying

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Don Luis Alberto tiene  tiene cinco hijos mayores de edad, todos trabajan, solamente depende de el un nieto que sus esposa y el lo tienen a cargo, trabaja como guarda de seguridad desde hace  siete años,  el esta solicitando su quinto credito para construir una habitaciòn  para tener mejor comodidad para su nieto y el resto de familia, el se ha caracterizado por ser un hombre responsable, honesto y muy trabajador en sus dias libres se dedica a cultivar la tierra, su sueño es tener mucha salud , trabajo y que sus hijos sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto has five grown children who all work. The only one who is dependent on him is a grandson that he and his wife are raising. He has worked as a security guard for seven years. He is asking for his fifth loan to build a room to make his grandson and the rest of the family more comfortable. He has been characterized as being a responsible man who is honest and hard-working. On his days off he cultivates the land. His dream is to have good health, work, and that his children become good people.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room

loans.name: Eva De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
Esta señora se llama Eva de los Ángeles S. G., tiene 55 años de edad, es madre soltera con tres hijos que mantener, de los cuales a dos les mantiene sus estudios, trabaja para la Alcaldía de Chichigalpa, institución en la cual tiene 12 años de laborar, en dicha institución obtiene un salario de C$ 4,789.00.
Esta señora ha obtenido en nuestra institución la cantidad de cinco créditos. El crédito que actualmente nos está solicitando lo requiere pago de gastos de funeral de su Mamá que falleció hace un mes y para compra de útiles escolares, tales como: mochilas, cuadernos, lápices, uniformes, zapatos.
Es buenos hacer notar que con los créditos anteriores, ella ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de su propiedad.
texts.en:
Eva de los Ángeles S. G., 55, is a single mother of three dependent children, two of whom are still in school. She has been employed by the Chichigalpa mayor's office for 12 years where she earns a salary of C$4,789.00. She has had five previous loans with us. The funding she is asking for on this occasion is to pay for her mother's funeral expenses; she died a month ago. In addition, it will be used to buy school supplies like: bookbags, notebooks, pencils, school uniforms, shoes. It is worth noting that she used her previous loans to improve her home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay funeral expenses and to buy school supplies (bookbags, notebooks, pencils, school uniforms, shoes)

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: Patricia, es una mujer muy solidaria, vive en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, región Ucayali, tiene 40 años, es madre de tres hijos, todos mayores de edad, ella se dedica a la extracción de madera y en forma eventual a la preparación de tortas y buffet, la extracción de madera la realiza desde su casa ya que ella envía personas a la selva para la extracción de la madera mientras que la preparación de tortas lo hace en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien es ingeniero agrónomo de profesión y la apoya en el negocio. Patricia forma parte del Banco Comunal “Amigas por Siempre”, desde hace cinco años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en la compra de víveres para enviar a su gente que se encarga de extraer la madera. Actualmente recibirá un crédito de 800 soles que utilizará para comprar víveres y enviarlo a las personas que trabajan en la extracción de madera. La meta de Patricia es tener una pollería en su casa.
texts.en:
Patricia is a woman who is very supportive of others. She lives in the District of Yarina Cocha, Ucayali Region. Patricia engages in harvesting timber and preparing cakes and buffet meals. She manages her timber business from home and hires people to go into the jungle to harvest timber while she prepares cakes. Her husband, who is an agronomy engineer by profession, provides his support for her business.

Patricia joined the Communal Bank “Amigas por Siempre” (Friends Forever) five years ago. The first loan she received was in the amount of 300 soles and used to buy food to send to the people in charge of harvesting the timber. She will now receive a loan of 800 soles and use it for the same purpose. Her goal is to establish a store in her home where she can sell chickens.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase food to feed the workers hired to harvest timber

loans.name: Luis Manuel

texts.es: El joven Luis Manuel vive con sus padres en colonia San Antonio a 15 kilometros de Nueva Guinea, y aunque aun no se ha casado es un joven muy responsable  y le brinda apoyo a sus padres con los  gastos familiares, se desempeña como docente de primaria  desde hace cuatro años, actualmente  esta estudiando  una licenciatura en ciencias de la Educaciòn ya ama su trabajo, el se caracteriza por  es un hombre humilde , responsable con muchos deseos de seguir estudiando, El se siente agradecido con la Institución de AFODENIC ya que con el credito  anterior logro comprar un solar en la zona urbana de Nueva Guinea, y este credito lo desea para comenzar la construccion de un cuarto en este solar y poco a poco tener su propia casa, sueña con tener en el futurouna vivienda amplia, bonita y trabajo para salir adelante con todos sus proyectos.
texts.en:
Luis Manuel lives with his parents in the San Antonio neighborhood, 15 kilometers from Nueva Guinea. Although he isn't married yet, he is a very responsible young man who helps his parents with family expenses. For the last four years he has been an elementary school teacher and he is currently studying to get his bachelor's in education; he loves his work. He is an unassuming, very responsible young man who wants to continue to study. He is grateful to AFODENIC because his last loan allowed him to buy a plot of land in Nueva Guinea's urban zone. He will use this funding to build a room on the lot so as to begin to build his own house bit by bit. He dreams with having a spacious, pretty home in the future and to continue to work and get ahead with his various projects.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a room.

loans.name: Noris

texts.es: Noris, es una socia nueva, vive en el distrito de Callería, región Ucayali, tiene 22 años, es soltera y estudiante de contabilidad en la Universidad Nacional de Ucayali. Eella se dedica a vender productos de belleza, esta actividad la realiza ofreciendo sus productos a sus amigos y compañeros de la Universidad. Noris forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Orquídeas”, ella necesita de un crédito de 300 soles, que será invertido en productos de belleza como cremas, perfumes, etc.		    El anhelo de Noris es tener una Ferretería bien surtida que le permita mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Noris is a new member, who lives in the district of Callería in Ucayali. She is 22 years old, is single and is an accounting student in the National University of Ucayali. She sells beauty products by offering her products to her friends and peers in the University. Noris is a member of the “Las Orquídeas” Community Bank, and she needs a loan for 300 PEN, which she will invest in beauty products, including creams, perfumes, etc. She wants to have a well-stocked hardware store to allow her to increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will use the loan to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 35 años y vive con su esposo en su casa propia.
Desde hace 6 años tiene una tienda que implementó en su misma vivienda. Ella atiende todos los días, incluidos los fines de semana, y son su madre y su hermana sus principales apoyos en este negocio, ya que no solo comercializa comestibles, sino también medicinas, adornos, golosinas  y útiles de escritorio. 
Durante este tiempo de permanencia con su negocio, ha notado las ventajas de ser independiente, y por ello desea incrementar sus productos y ampliar el espacio de su tienda.

Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella fue invitada a formar parte de su banco comunal porque la conocen como una persona responsable. El dinero que solicita lo utilizará en la compra de abarrotes y golosinas.
texts.en:
Carmen, 35, lives with her husband in their own home. For the last six years she has run a grocery store that she set up at home. She tend to it daily, including weekends, with help from her mother and sister. She doesn't just stock food items but also medicine, decorations, sweets, and stationery items. During the time that she has had her business she has learned the advantages of being independent so she wants to increase her stock and expand her selling area. This is her first loan with MFP; she was invited to be part of a communal bank because she is known to be a responsible person. The funds will be used to buy grocery stock items and sweets.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Jairo

texts.es: Jairo habita en el municipio del Coral,  tiene un año de laborar como responsable de Planificaciòn  de la Alcaldia del Coral Chontales, este joven esta felizmente casado tiene dos hijos menores de edad, su esposa  cuida de sus hijos y de los quehaceres del Hogar, esta solicitando su primer crédito a la institución de AFODENIC para ser invertido en mejora de su vivienda, poniendo el piso de su casa y reparando una parte que se encuentra dañada.  Jairo sueña con un porvenir mejor para su familia, tener una casa bonita con mejores condiciones para su familia, según referencias lo consideran como un hombre responsable,  honesto y de buenos valores morales.
texts.en:
Jairo lives in Coral and has worked for the last year in the planning department of the Coral Chontales mayor's office. He is happily married and has two minor children. His wife cares for their children and tends to household chores. He is asking AFODENIC for his first loan do do some home inprovements; he wants to install flooring in his home and to repair a section that is damaged. Jairo dreams with providing a better future for his family, to have a pretty house with better condiditons for his family. According to references, he is considered to be a responsible, honest man with good moral values.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Floor repair.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena tiene 30 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia.
Desde hace 10 años se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos. Primero trabajaba de manera dependiente, pero luego se propuso tener su propio negocio, por lo que arrendó un terreno de suelo arcilloso para fabricar sus ladrillos. Actualmente, su esposo es quien trabaja a tiempo completo, y ella lo hace medio día para poder velar por sus hijos. Asimismo, cuenta con el apoyo de algunos de sus familiares para la fabricación de los ladrillos y ella se encarga de la comercialización.

Esta es la octava oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP y hasta el momento se siente muy contenta de ser parte de un banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita lo utilizará en la compra los materiales necesarios para la fabricación de ladrillos, tales como aserrín y arena fina.
texts.en:
Elena, 30, lives with her husband and two children in her own home. For the last 10 years she has manufactured bricks. At the beginning, she was employed by someone else but then, she decided to become independent and set up her own business. She leased a lot that was rich in clay to start her brick making. Currently, her husband works the business full-time and she does half-time so that she can look after her children. In addition, some of her relatives help her make the bricks and she sells them. This is her 8th loan with MFP and she is happy to be part of a communal bank. The funds requested will be used to buy supplies, like sawdust and fine sand, needed to make bricks.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase brick-making supplies.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca tiene 54 años, vive con su esposo y el último D. sus hijos.
DesD. hace 6 años decidió explotar al máximo el recurso que tiene en sus terrenos D. suelos arcillosos, por lo que empezó a fabricar ladrillos. Para ello, contrata la mano D. obra D. personas expertas en la fabricación y luego los comercializa. Al mes venD. un promedio D. 20 millares  D. ladrillos, lo cual le sirve para solventar los gastos D. su familia, a parte del dinero que aporta su esposo. 
Francisca se proyecta al futuro y desea tener más extensiones D. tierra arcillosa para fabricar mayor cantidad D. ladrillos. 

Esta es la novena oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella siempre ha sido muy estricta en el cumplimiento D. sus cuotas y en esta ocasión no será la excepción. El dinero que ahora solicita le servirá para la compra D. cobertizos D. plásticos que le servirán para proteger sus ladrillos y también otros materiales necesarios para la fabricación.
texts.en:
Francisca, 54, lives with her husband and their youngest son. For the last 6 years she has been dedicated to exploiting, to the greatest extent possible, the resource she has in her clay-rich property: she makes bricks. She hires expert help to manufacture the bricks and she takes care of the sales. She sells approximately 20,000 bricks per month, which, added to her husband's earnings, is enough to meet family expenses. As Francsica looks to the future, she would like to have more clay-rich land to make a greater quantity of bricks. This is her 9th loan with MFP. She has always been very strict about making her repayments on time and this time will not be the exception to this. The funds requested now will be used to buy plastic sheeting that will protect her bricks and other supplies needed for their manufacture.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy plastic sheeting to protect her bricks.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Jesús tiene 30 años, vive con su esposa y su hijo en una casa arrendada.
Desde hace 4 años trabaja fabricando ladrillos de manera dependiente, pero también tiene la opción de comprar y vender a mayor precio los ladrillos que ella fabrica. Estas ganancias le han servido para sostener a su familia, mientras que su esposa también apoya con la economía de su casa realizando bordados de trajes típicos.
Para el futuro, Jesús quiere tener su propia fábrica de ladrillos para poder disponer libremente de su tiempo. 

Esta es la sexta oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP y siempre ha demostrado ser muy puntual en el pago de sus créditos. El dinero que ahora solicita será invertido en la compra de ladrillos, al por mayor. También apoyará a su esposa comprando los materiales textiles que utiliza para sus bordados.
texts.en:
Jesús, 30, lives with his wife and son in a rented house. For the last 4 years he has been employed as a brick maker. However, he has the option to buy the bricks he makes and sell them at a higher price. These profits allow him to support his family while his wife contributes too by embroidering traditional outfits. For the future, Jesús wants to have his own brick-making factory so that he can be master of his own time. This is his 6th loan with MFP and he has always been very punctual with his payments. The funds requested now will be used to buy bricks at wholesale and to help his wife buy the textile supplies she needs for her embroidery.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bricks and to invest in his wife's business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 28 años y vive en compañía de su madre en la casa de ella.
Desde niña se ha dedicado a la elaboración de bordados para los trajes típicos de su localidad. Esta labor la realiza en su misma casa, todos los días y en el horario que más le acomode; su madre también le ayuda para que sus trabajos sean muy coloridos y de buena calidad, y una vez terminada su producción entrega a los clientes que solicitaron sus servicios. 

Esta es la quinta oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella es una persona muy responsable con sus pagos, y también es parte de un banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de hilos dorados, plateados y de otros diversos colores.
texts.en:
María is 28 years old and lives with her mother in her mother’s house. Since childhood she has been involved in embroidering the traditional clothing of her region. She carries out this work every day in her own house and according to a schedule which suits her. Her mother helps her. Their work is very colorful and of good quality. Upon finishing work on projects they deliver to customers who have sought their services.

This is the fifth time María has had a loan with MFP. She is very responsible about making her payments and is also a member of a communal bank. She will invest the money that she is now applying for in the purchase of thread of gold, silver and other diverse colors.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of embroidery materials.

loans.name: Roman

texts.es:
Roman tiene 37 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos en el sector Punto 9 del distrito de Mochumí, ubicado a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de gasolina en su domicilio desde hace dos años. Inició esta actividad debido a que los ingresos que percibia trabajando como obrero agrícola no eran suficientes para solventar los gastos familiares. La gasolina es de mucha utilidad en la zona donde vive, sobretodo para el riego de campos de sembrío, ya que la mayor parte de terrenos agrícolas no cuentan con canales de regadío y tienen que regar sus cultivos con agua de pozo extraida por motores.

Adicionalmente trabaja como obrero agrícola. Roman sabe que tiene que esforzarse al máximo todos los dias para sacar adelante a su familia, por ello siempre da todo de sí en las labores que realiza. El se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que planea utilizar en la ampliación de su negocio de venta de gasolina.

Su mas grande anhelo es brindarle a sus hijos la posibilidad de estudiar algun tipo de carrera superior cuando terminen sus estudios secundarios. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser un cliente puntual y responsable al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Roman, 37, is married and lives with his wife and three children in the Punto 9 sector, Mochumí district, which is 30 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo. For the last two years he has sold gasoline from his home. He began this work because the earnings he made from working as a field hand were not enough to meet family expenses. Gasoline is very useful in the area where he lives, above all for irrigation of farmlands, because the great majority of fields do not have irrigation canals and the crops must be watered with water that is extracted from wells by motors. He also works as an agricultural field hand. Roman is aware that he must exhert the greatest effort daily if he is to support his family so he gives his all to the tasks he does. He is asking Edpyme Alternativa for 1500 new soles to be used to enlarge his gasoline-sales business. His greatest wish is to provide his children with the possibility to study some kind of a professional career when they finish secondary school. He has collaborated with our institution in the past and he has shown himself to be responsible and punctual with respect to repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy gasoline.

loans.name: Wilfreda

texts.en:
Wilfreda L. is from the village of Kimanait, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. Wilfreda is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Wilfreda owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store where she sells both food & daily use products in the local community. Wilfreda has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Wilfreda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilfreda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Wilfreda decided to request a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Wilfreda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children's education. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand inventory

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es:
Eulalia es una madre de familia de 42 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en el caserío Narihualá, del distrito de Catacaos, provincia de Piura en la Región Piura, ubicada a 3 horas y 30 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El anhelo de sacar adelante a sus hijos llevó a ella y a su esposo a trabajar en la venta de algarrobina (jalea hecha a base del fruto del algarrobo) y miel de abeja, ambos ofrecen esta mercadería de manera ambulante en los terminales terrestres de la ciudad de Piura. La algarrobina es preparada por ellos en sus casas y la miel de abeja la adquieren de los apicultores de la zona. Ambos productos son embotellados para luego ofrecerlos al público.

Eulalia desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más miel de abeja para empezar a ofrecerla en otros distritos. Por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 600 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en el logro de su objetivo.

Ella es una madre que dia a dia da todo de si para seguir adelante y progresar junto a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es llegar a tener su propia marca de productos naturales y empezar a distribuirlos.
texts.en:
Eulalia is 42 years old, married, and lives with her husband and two children in Narihualá, a settlement in the district of Catacaos, in Piura Province in the Piura Region, three hours away from the city of Chiclayo. With the hope of helping their children get ahead, she and her husband started to sell 'algarrobina', jelly made from the fruit of the algarrobo tree, and honey. They both sell these items as street vendors at the bus terminals in the city of Piura. They make the algarrobina themselves at home, and buy the honey from beekeepers in the area. Both products are bottled for sale. Eulalia would like expand her business by buying larger quantities of honey and selling it in other districts. She has asked for her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 600 new soles, which she will use to achieve this goal. As a mother, she gives of herself everyday to improve her family's situation and prospects for the future. Her greatest wish is to eventually be able to sell natural products under her own trademark.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy honey in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Eduarda

texts.es:
Eduarda tiene 32 años, es conviviente y tiene dos hijos: Leida tiene 15 años y Lisbeth tiene 10 años. Eduarda se levanta muy temprano para hacer sus actividades del hogar como por ejemplo preparar desayuno y mandar a sus hijos menores al colegio. Eduarda y su esposo se dedican a la venta  de pollo congelado. La socia vende condimentos en el mercado antiguo de Urubamba. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Eduarda requiere el préstamo para comprar más condimentos como pimienta, comino, sal, ají seco y muchos más condimentos. 

Eduarda pertenece al banco comunal “VILLA RAYANNIYOC” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. La ciudad de Rayanniyoc esta ubicado a unos 30 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en:
Eduarda is 32 years old; she lives with her common law husband and has 2 children: fifteen year old Leida and ten year old Lisbeth. Eduarda gets up very early each day to do her household chores, such as preparing breakfast and sending her children to school. She and her husband earn a living by selling frozen chicken. She sells spices in Urubamba’s old market and has had this business for several years. It has gone well thanks to her effort and dedication. Eduarda will use the loan to buy more spices, such as pepper, cumin, salt and dry chile. She is a member of “VILLA RAYANNIYOC”, a communal bank of the Arariwa Association, and is very grateful for this opportunity. She promises to pay back the loan according to the payment schedule. The city of Rayanniyoc is half an hour away from the city of Cusco.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Eduarda will use the loan to buy more spices, such as pepper, cumin, salt, dry chile and others.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose Paller, Jr. is from the village of Langcata-on, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. Jose is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Jose owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Jose has been engaged in his business for over 30 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Jose joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jose has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from HSPFI. Jose opted to request a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Jose from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Arely Vanessa

texts.es:
La  señora Arely Vanessa M. R., labora como colectora de ruta en el mercado de Mayoreo de Managua, ha trabajado con Ceprodel durante cuatro años y en ese lapso ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de su vivida con los  créditos que ha trabajado con Ceprodel.

El crédito solicitado es para la reparación de su carro ya que actualmente lo tiene en mal estado.

Arely dijo que gracias a los prestamos otorgados por ceprodel ha podido salir adelante.
texts.en:
Mrs. Arely Vanessa M. R. earns her living as a route collector at Managua’s wholesale market. She has worked with Ceprodel for four years and in that time she has been able to make improvements in her life thanks to the loans she has received from Ceprodel. The loan will be used to fix her car as it is not in good condition. Arely states that she has been able to get ahead thanks to the loans she has received from Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make repairs to her car.

loans.name: Yuri Yasser

texts.es:
El señor Yuri Yasser U. M., labora como colector de ruta del mercado de mayoreo Managua, ha trabajado con Ceprodel durante tres años y en ese lapso ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda con los tres  créditos que ha trabajado con Ceprodel.

El es casado con dos hijos y estos se encuentran en edad escolar.

El crédito solicitado es para la compra de ladrillos para su vivienda con el fin de darles un mejor estilo de vida a sus hijos que tanto requieren del apoyo de su padre.
texts.en:
Yuri Yasser U. M. works as a route collector in the Managua wholesale market. He has worked with Ceprodel for three years, and in this time he has managed to improve the condition of his house with the three loans he has received from Ceprodel. He is married, with two school-age children. The requested loan is for the purchase of bricks for his house so he can give a better quality of life to his children, who so greatly need their father's support.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements and expansion

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Juana Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Juana  Mercedes O. C., labora como oficinista en el centro de insumo para la salud, ha trabajado con Ceprodel durante dos años y en ese lapso ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda con los dos créditos que ha trabajado con Ceprodel.

 Ella es casada y tiene tres hijos dos de estos se encuentran en edad escolar.

El crédito solicitado es para la compra de zinc y perlines, para su casa de habitación, con el fin de darles un mejor estilo de vida a sus hijos que tanto requieren del apoyo de su padre.

Juana dijo que gracias a los préstamos otorgados por ceprodel su vivienda ha mejorado.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana Mercedes O. C. is an office worker at the health supply center. She has worked with Ceprodel for two years, and in this time she has managed to improve the conditions of her home with two credits through Ceprodel. She is married and has three children, two of whom are of school age. The requested loan will be used for the purchase of zinc and timber, for her home, with the objective of giving a better quality of life to her children, who require a lot of support from their parents. Juana says that thanks to the loans granted to her through Ceprodel, her home has improved.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve and expand her home

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Luz Yanet

texts.es:
Luz tiene 27 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a sus padres en el sector Prada del distrito de Motupe, ubicado a hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la costureria desde hace cinco años, estudió la carrera de corte y confección en un instituto de la ciudad de Chiclayo y cuando terminó sus estudios instaló en su vivienda un pequeño taller donde atiende los pedidos que le hacen sus habituales clientes. Paralelamente también confecciona ropa de manera independiente y la ofrece en venta.

Ella se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de más material (telas e hilos) para ampliar su negocio, ya que la calidad con la que elabora su trabajo ha hecho que se haga conocida en la zona y que siempre tenga clientes solicitando sus servicios.

Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria y hacer crecer su taller. Esta es la segunda vez que Luz trabaja con nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Luz is 27 years old, single and lives together with her parents in sector Prada, Motupe district, situated about and 1.5 hours away from Chiclayo.

She has been a seamstress for 5 years and studied confeccion and styling at an insitute in Chiclayo. When she finished her studies, she built a small shop on the side of her house where she attends the requests of her clients. In parallel to this, she makes clothes to order and offers them for sale.

She is soliciting a loan from Edpyme Alternative for 1500 nuevos soles that she thinks she will use in the purchase of more material (cloth and string) to grow her business. The quality with which she has done her busines has made her well known in the area and has customers who solicit her services.

Her wish is to continue to grow as a business woman and to grow her business. This is the second time that Luz worked with our insititution and she has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility when taking on debt.

Translated from Spanish by karl baumgarten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth and string to grow her business

loans.name: Charlita

texts.en: In 2005, Charlita B. joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Charlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her rice production. Charlita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for her rice production. Charlita is requesting her third loan from PMPC. Charlita wants to live a good life and maintain a good standing with the cooperative.

loans.use: To finance her rice production

loans.name: Nael

texts.fr: Nael KÂ est une femme de 47 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 5 ans et a été 10fois de suite bénéficiaire de prêt. Son activité principal est l'embouche bovine et ovine, une activité qui lui permet de participer au bien-être familiale et de renforcer ses épargnes
texts.en:
Nael KÂ is a 47 year-old married mother of four. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois for five years and has received 10 consecutive loans. She is involved in the fattening of cattle and sheep for a living, which allows her to see to her family’s well-being and put money aside as savings.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her business productivity

loans.name: Remelyn

texts.en:
Remelyn C. is from the village of Salimpuno. She is 23 years old. Remelyn is married and has an infant child. To make a living, Remelyn owns & operates a store where she sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Remelyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Remelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Remelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Remelyn is requesting a new loan of 55,000 PHP, which will be used to fully pay for a transport vehicle to improve her business. She will also use the loan as additional capital for her mini grocery store. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Remelyn from PMPC and the second loan funded by Kiva. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To fully pay for a motorcycle

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene T. is from the city of Oroquieta. She is 26 years old, married and has one infant child. To make a living, Irene owns and operates a business that provides motorcycle-for-hire services to local community members. She has been in this kind of business for about five years and earns approximately PHP 6,000 a month. 

In 2007, Irene joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Irene is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase a cab to attach to her motorcycle to improve the business. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Irene from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a side cab for her motorcycle

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou D. est une femme de 39 ans, elle es mariée et mère de 8 enfants en charge et 1 neveu de plus qu'on lui a confié. Elle fait de l'embouche ovine, une activité qui lui procure de revenus qui lui permette de participer à la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Fatou D. is a 39 year-old married woman with eight children of her own and a nephew in her care. She rears and fattens sheep for a living; this brings in revenue so that she can look after her family’s needs.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve her ability to finance herself

loans.name: Véronique

texts.fr: Véronique est âgée de 39 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. son activité principale est la vente sur table de produits divers tels que des légumes comme les choux, les aubergines amères etc. en parallèle elle fait de l'embouche porcine. Son objectif est de renforcer son épargne et de particper à la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Véronique is a 39 year-old married mother of three. She sells various products, such as vegetables like cabbages, bitter eggplant etc, from a tabletop stall; alongside this she also fattens pigs. Her aim is to increase her savings and contribute actively to her family’s wellbeing.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Promote her business activities

loans.name: Ret

texts.en: Mrs. Ret K. is 30 years old and she lives in Phngeas village, Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 3.5-hectare field to cultivate rice to earn for living. Her husband, Mr. Narn Orn, is duck breeder. Since her husband’s business is going well, he wants to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Ret K. decided to ask for 2,000,000 Riel from AMK to buy more ducklings and duck food, and the rest of the loan she would use to buy fertilizers, rice seed, and pesticides to support her rice field. Mrs. Ret K. is a mother of a child. This child is still too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, rice seed, and pesticides.

loans.name: Amélia

texts.fr: Amélia est une femme de 54 ans, elle est veuve et a 6 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de WALIDANE depuis 5 ans. Elle fait de la couture, elle possède d'une machine à coudre à main à domicile et confectionne sur mesures et sur commande, cette activité lui procure des ressources qui lui permettent de prendre en charge ses enfants et de subvenir à ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Amélia is a 54-year-old woman who is a widow with six children to support.  She has been a member of Banc Villageois de WALIDANE for five years.  She is a seamstress and has a manual sewing machine that she uses to make clothes for custom orders at her home.  This business  brings in the resources that enable her to support her children and to provide for her personal needs. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her working capital

loans.name: Um

texts.en: Um P., 59, is widowed and lives with her two children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. Phunn is a housewife. The family is supported, mainly, by her two children who are employed in a private company. They earn an income of USD 8 each, per day. P. and her family members try to work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family. They are seeking to improve their businesses as well as to get rid with the daily necessary expenses. Therefore, P. is requesting a loan of US $800 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the expected loan to buy a motorbike for her children to commute to work easily. This is his first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the children to commute to work.

loans.name: Roatha

texts.en: Mrs. Roatha A. is 29 years old and she lives in Prey Khla Khang Cheung village, Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 3-hectare field of land to cultivate rice. In order to support her field she has decided to ask for a loan. With the funds, she will buy a water machine, fertilizers, and pesticides. Aside from farming, she is a grocer. She sells the groceries in the local market. Her husband, Mr. Somoeun Thou, is a teacher in the local village. He earns a salary to support the family members. Mrs. Roatha A. is mother of a child who is too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy a water machine, fertilizers, and pesticides.

loans.name: Coumba

texts.fr: Coumba S. est une femme de 48 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 3 ans et a eu 6 expériences avec le crédit. Elle fait de l'élevage de mouton , une activité qui lui procure des ressources additionnelles lui permettant de participer à la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Coumba S. is a 48-year-old woman. She is married and the mother of six. She has been a member of Banc Villageois for three years and has had six experiences with loans. She raises sheep, a business that brings in additional resources that enable her to take part in family responsibilities.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Advancing her work raising sheep

loans.name: Aïssatou

texts.fr: Aïssatou T. est une femme de 64 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est membre de banc Villageois depuis 4 ans et demi. Elle fait de l'embouche bovine et ovine. son objectif est de participer aux différentes charges familiales.
texts.en:
Aïssatou T. is a 64-year-old woman who is married and the mother of four. She has been a member of Banc Villageois for 3½ years. She fattens cows and sheep. Her goal is to help with the various family responsibilities.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her business fattening cattle

loans.name: Nget

texts.en: Mrs. Nget K. lives in Angk Roveay village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Phal Daok, are silk weavers. Since their business is going well from day-to-day, Mrs. Nget K. wants to expand it. She needs 2,000,000 Riel from AMK to buy more silk and raw materials to support her silk weaving. Mrs. Nget K. has six children, three of whom are silk weavers and the others are attending the local school. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more silk for weaving.

loans.name: Khiev

texts.en: Khiev K. S., 40, is married and lives with his four school-aged children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. S. operates his motorbike as a driver in the city, earning an income of USD 10 per day. He has been in this business since 1999. His wife sells fish and vegetables at the market, earning a gross income of USD 50 per day. S. and her family members try to work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family. They are seeking to improve their businesses as well as to get ahead of the daily necessary expenses. Therefore, S. is requesting a loan of US $1000 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. He wants to use the anticipated loan to buy another motorbike to transport vegetables and fish to sell at the market. This is his first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport vegetable to sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Our featured entrepreneur is primarily engaged in snack vending and running a sari-sari store. She is Mrs. Erlinda B., 57 years of age, married and a resident of Dimalco, Bonifacio, Mis. Occ. Her husband Remegio is a farmer and a carpenter. Under these conditions, they've felt financial hardships, especially in raising 13 children. To help her husband, she decided to engage in snack vending and operating a little sari-sari store in their house. At this time, she is earning an average net income of at least 1,500 PHP a month in which is very beneficial to the family. For her first loan, she borrowed 3,000 PHP to add to her capital for her snack vending and sari-sari store business. She is hoping that her business will become more progressive in the future and through these activities, she will be able to send all her dependent children to school.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Khun

texts.en: Khun C., 54, is married and lives with his four children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. C. grows morning glories, earning an income of US $6 per day. He has been doing this business since 1993. His wife looks after the children and helps her husband grow more vegetables, earning US $6 per day. C. and his family members try to work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family. They are seeking to improve their businesses as well as to get rid of the daily necessary expenses. Therefore, C. is requesting a loan of US $1,000 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. He wants to use the loan to buy more morning glory seeds and a motorbike for the children to use to commute to school. This is his first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy seeds and a motorbike

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou D. est une femme de 45 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SILANE depuis 6 ans. elle fait le commerce de sucre et d'huile d'arachide qu'elle a elle même extraite. Son objectif est de renforcer son niveau d'épargne et de participer aux différentes charges familiales.
texts.en:
Fatou D. is a 45-year-old woman, married and mother of seven children. She has been a member of the ‘Banc Villageois’ loan group of SILANE for six years. Her business is selling sugar and peanut oil that she extracts herself. Her objective is to increase her level of savings and share in managing various family expenses.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolster her capacity for self-financing

loans.name: Meraluna

texts.en: Mrs. Meraluna L. is 37 years of age, married, and a resident of Remedios, Bonifacio, Mis. Occ. She is married to Walter L., a carpenter. They were blessed with four children. Two of the children are adults and two are now school age. Under these conditions, they had a financial crisis. For her first loan, she has the privilege of borrowing P3,000 to add to her capital for her sari-sari store to help her husband raise their family. The future income from this business will be used for the daily basic needs, savings and loan repayments. She is hoping that this business will become successful and progressive.

loans.use: Additional capital for her store

loans.name: Sokhna

texts.fr: Sokhna D. est une femme de 29 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Vilageois depuis 7 ans. Elle fait de la broderie et vente de draps de lit. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de renforcer ses épargnes et de participer à la prise en charge familiale
texts.en:
Sokhna D. is a 29-year-old woman, married and mother of four children. She has been a member of a ‘Banc Villageois’ loan group for seven years. She does embroidery and sells bedsheets. Her earnings allow her to increase her savings level and participate in managing household expenses.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolster her commercial activity

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia B. is from the village of Tuburan Aloran Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old. Cecilia is married and has three grown children. To make a living, Cecilia owns and operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafood products such as fish and shrimp to the local community. Cecilia has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Cecilia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cecilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC. Cecilia is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to repair a rental fishing boat. This will be the second loan taken out by Cecilia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Repair rental fishing boat

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes D. is presently residing at Poblacion 2, Oroquieta City. She is married, 43 years old, and a mother of three school-aged children. To make a living, Lourdes raise pigs and sells them to the local community. She has been engaged in this kind of business for about seven years and earns approximately PHP 10,000 per two months.

In 2008, Lourdes joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of PHP 10,000 from PMPC. Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her business. She will use the loan for the purchase of feeds and vitamins for her piglets. This will be the third loan she has taken out from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. Her other future plan is for her children to finish their studies and hopefully establish their own careers.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase feed and vitamins for pigs

loans.name: Aïssatou

texts.fr: Aïssatou D. est une femme de 45 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants et de 3 autres dont elle a la charge. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 9 ans et a eu 18 expérience en matière de crédit. elle fait de la broderie et parallèlement elle vend de l'encens. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie familiale et de renforcer ses épargnes.
texts.en:
Aïssatou D. is a 45-year-old woman, married and mother of five children. Three other children are under her care. She has been a member of a ‘Banc Villageois’ loan group for nine years and has 18 years experience with credit matters. She does embroidery, in addition to which she sells incense. Her income allows her to participate in the improvement of family living conditions and bolster her savings.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Promote her commercial activities

loans.name: Phun

texts.en: Phun K., 45, is married and lives with her two school-aged children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. K.'s business is selling brooms in the city, earning an income of US $3 per day. She has been in this business since 1998. Her husband sells brooms as well, earning US $3 per day. He travels everywhere in his province to sell his broom products. K. and her family members try to work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family. They are seeking to improve their businesses as well as cover their necessary daily expenses. Therefore, K. is requesting a loan of US $1000 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the loan to buy cows to plow her rice field and to transport the rice to store at home. This is her first loan from CREDIT. (Her husband is pictured here.)

loans.use: Purchase cows to help plow rice field and transport rice

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca L. is from the village of Hasan Lopez Jaena Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old. Rebecca is married and has eight school-aged children. To make a living, Rebecca owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks like rice cakes called "puto" in the local community. Rebecca has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 700 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rebecca joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rebecca is requesting a new loan of 3500 PHP, which will be used to buy additional capital for her business. This will be the first loan taken out by Rebecca from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the daily needs of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en: 40-year-old Adelfa farms for a living. She is married and has five children. Her oldest is now 18 years old and goes to school. She works hard so she can send her children to school and provide for her family’s needs. She said that her one-hectare farm is really helpful to her family, which is why she makes sure it is productive. She also sought the help of CEVI, an MFI [micro-finance institution] in the Philippines. She became a member and is now requesting a loan of PHP 7,000. She will use this loan to fund her farm. She will be able to buy farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie C. is from the village of Libertad Bajo, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old, is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Elvie owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Elvie has been engaged in her business for over 26 years and earns approximately 3,200 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2005, Elvie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Elvie is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will also be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the eleventh loan which Elvie has taken out from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in north-western Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Feliza

texts.en:
Feliza tills a rice field with patience. At 46, she has to keep healthy to be able to endure the hard work required at the farm. She helps her husband keep the farm free of weeds and in good condition. They have four children with the oldest being 27 years old and Feliza does her best to make sure her family’s needs are being supplied.

As a member of CEVI, Feliza is grateful that she has gained access to financial opportunities. She is now requesting  a loan of Php 7,000. This loan will be used  to purchase farm supplies such as seeds, fertilizers, etc.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies such as seeds, fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Pat

texts.en:
Pat R., 23, is married and lives with her one-year-old child in Takeo Province, Cambodia. R. is employed at a local garment factory in the city, earning an income of US$2 per day. She has been with this business since 2005. Her husband is a driver who transports dirt for landfill for people in different provinces, earning US$4 per day. (R.'s husband is pictured in the photo.)

R. and her family members try to work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family. They are seeking to improve their businesses as well as to get rid of necessary daily expenses. Therefore, R. is requesting a loan of US$800 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the loan to purchase a motorbike to commute to work. This is her first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to commute to work

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica M. is from the village of Poblacion, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 53 years old, is married and has one adult child. To make a living, Veronica owns amd operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting coconut for sale. Veronica has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Veronica joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Veronica is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the sixth loan Veronica has taken out from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Saint Rhode

texts.en:
Saint Rhode is from Happy Valley Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. He is 27 years old and married with two children. To make a living, Saint Rhode operates a computer and photocopying center. His business earns approximately 9000 PHP a month. In 2009, Saint Rhode joined PMPC to improve their living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He successfully repaid his previous loan of 5000 PHP from PMPC. Now he has applied for a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase school and office supplies. This will be the second loan Saint Rhode has taken out from PMPC. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in north-western Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase school and office supplies

loans.name: Marie Hélène

texts.fr: Marie Hélène D. est une femme de 38 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 5 ans. Elle fait de l'embouche ovine et les bénéfices gérés de cette activité lui permettent de s'équiper en meubles et de s'occuper de sa progéniture.
texts.en:
Marie Hélène D. is a 38-year-old woman, married and mother of three children. She has been a member of the local ‘Banc Villageois’ loan group for five years. Her occupation is fattening sheep. The income generated by this activity allows her to acquire furniture and take care of her progeny.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolster her working capital

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is now preparing her land to plant rice crops. She is 42 years old and has five children. Aside from farming, she also raises pigs to add to her family's income. One of her goals is to improve her family’s living conditions.

She also joined CEVI to expand her business opportunities. She is now requesting to borrow Php 7,000. She will use this loan to purchase necessary farm supplies like seeds and fertilizers for her farm.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Norie

texts.en:
Norie is 30 years old and has three children. She lives in a town in Agusan Del Sur. Like most of the people in her town, she is also involved in rice farming. When free of farming duties, she spends her time taking care of her pigs. She invested in a hog-raising business to add to her family’s income.

Norie is applying for a loan of Php 7,000. She will use this loan to buy farming supplies like seeds and fertilizers and also feed for the pigs.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Som

texts.en:
Som V., 31, is married and lives with her two-year-old child in Takeo Province, Cambodia. V. is employed at a local garment factory in the city, earning an income of US$2 per day. She has been with this business since 2002. Her husband is a salt middleman, earning US$4 per day. He sells salt products in his village and in the province. (V.'s husband is pictured here.)

V. and her family members try to work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family. They are seeking to improve their businesses as well as to get rid of necessary daily expenses. Therefore, V. is requesting a loan of US$850 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the loan to purchase more salt products for sale. This is her first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy more salt products for sale

loans.name: Dié

texts.fr: Dié TALL es une femme de 44 ans, elle est célibataire sans enfant mais elle a la garde et charge de ses 2 nièces. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 5 ans et fait de l'embouche ovine. Ses revenus lui permettent d'entretenir les enfants qui sont à sa charge et de subvenir à ses propres besoins.
texts.en:
Dié TALL is a 44-year-old woman, unmarried, without children, but she provides support for her two nieces who are under her care. She has been a member of the local ‘Banc Villageois’ loan group for five years, and fattens sheep for a living. Her earnings provide for the children under her care and meet her own needs.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolster her capacity for investment

loans.name: Rodello

texts.en:
Rodello D. is from the village of Hasan Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. He is 30 years old, is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Rodello owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector selling fresh fish. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from catching fish  for sale. Rodello has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 1000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Rodello joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rodello is requesting a new loan of 3500 PHP which will be used to repair his pumpboat. This loan will be the first loan Rodello has taken out from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's daily needs. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair his pumpboat

loans.name: Yen

texts.en:
Yen N., 31, is married and lives with her two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. N. is in the business of selling handmade brooms in the city, earning an income of US$3 per day. She has been with this business since 2000. Her husband sells brooms as well in his village, earning US$3 per day.

N. and her family members try to work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family. They are seeking to improve their businesses as well as to get rid of necessary daily expenses. Therefore, N. is requesting a loan of US$1200 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the expected loan to buy more materials to produce brooms for sale. This is her first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy more materials to produce handmade brooms for sale

loans.name: Laila

texts.en: Laila F. is from the village of Miputak. She is 21 years old, is married, and has two infant children. Laila owns and operates a business providing transportation services such as motor cab to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Laila joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. Laila is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase construction materials for house repair. This loan will be her 5th from PMPC, and her second with Kiva. She plans to provide a better house for the family to live in. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for house repair

loans.name: Maguette

texts.fr: Maguette D. es une femme de 39 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 5 ans? Elle fait de l'embouche caprine, une activité qui lui permet de contribuer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille de renforcer son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
Maguette D. is 39-year old woman who is married and the mother of three children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois for five years. She fattens goats, a business that allows her to contribute to the improvement of her family's living conditions and to build up her savings.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen and expand her livestock business

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn B. is from the village of Gango, in the city of Ozamiz. She is 33 years old, married, and has three school-age children. To earn a living, Roselyn owns and operates a "sari-sari" store and a vegetable-selling business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different vegetables to her local community members. Roselyn has been engaged in this line of business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP per month on account of these activities.

In 2004, Roselyn joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) to gain access to financial services. As a result, she was able to engage in business activities and to improve her family's standard of living. Notably, Roselyn recently repaid a prior loan in the amount of 25,000 PHP from PMPC. Roselyn is now requesting another loan, this time in the amount of 50,000 PHP ($1,100), which will be used to buy housing materials for some much-needed home improvement work. This loan would be the sixth loan taken out by Roselyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business as a result of the loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor by using the Grameen micro-finance model.

loans.use: To purchase materials for much-needed home improvement work

loans.name: Mrs. Kao Meng Touch Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank, of which Mrs. Kao Meng T. is the leader, consists of 13 people and is located in Chamrov village, Takeo province. Mrs. Kao Meng T. is a 24-year-old married woman and mother of a young child.

Mrs. Kao Meng T. and her husband, Mr. Oeun S., are silk weavers. Because her business has been doing quite well, she would like to expand the business. Thus, Mrs. Kao Meng T. decided to seek a loan to buy more silks to support the business. In addition to her silk-weaving operations, Mrs. Kao Meng T. is a farmer. Specifically, she owns a piece of land on which she cultivates rice.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional silks

loans.name: Ryan Vennyl

texts.en:
Ryan Vennyl G. is from the village of Baybay, in Ozamis City. He is 31 years old and married. To earn a living, Ryan Vennyl owns and operates a business venture in the service sector. Specifically, his income is primary derived from providing motorcycle services to local community members. Ryan Vennyl has been engaged in this business for over six years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP per month on account of these activities.

In 2009, Ryan Vennyl joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. As a result, he was better able to engage in business activities and to improve his (and his wife's) standard of living. Notably, Ryan Vennyl already successfully repaid a prior loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Ryan Vennyl is now requesting another loan, this time in the amount of 15,000 PHP ($350), which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in his business. This loan would be the second loan taken out by Ryan Vennyl from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business as a result of the loan to improve the general living conditions of his family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices which cover the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen/women, and entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To improve his business by making vehicle repairs

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely C. is currently residing at Caputol, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 58 years old, married and the mother of 2 adult-aged children. Fely operates a business repairing damaged umbrellas, shoes, and other broken things which can be restored. She has been engaged in this kind of business for over 15 years and earns approximately Php 3,000.00 a month for these activities.

In 2006, Fely joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of Php 3,000.00 from PMPC. Fely is requesting a new loan of Php 5,000 which will be used as additional capital for her business. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by her from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model). *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchase additional materials needed for repairing damaged umbrellas, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Men

texts.en:
Men K. is in the business of producing handmade brooms to sell in her village. She is 48 years old, married and lives with her three children in Takeo province, Cambodia. K. earns US $2 per day. She has been in her business since 2000. Her husband is a skillful carpenter earning US $3 per day. 

K. and her family members work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for their family. They are seeking to improve their businesses as well as to cover necessary daily expenses. Therefore, K. is requesting a loan of US $1000 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the loan to buy a motorbike for her children to commute to work. This is her first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the children to commute to work

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio A. is from the village of Hasan, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. He is 24 years old. Antonio is married and has three infant children. To make a living, Antonio owns & operates a business providing motorcycle (habal-habal) services to the local community. Antonio has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Antonio joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Antonio is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used additional capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Antonio from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the needs of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Digna

texts.en:
Mrs. Digna P. is from Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 41 years old and married with 5 children. Mrs Digna and her husband have owned a motorcycle repair shop for more than 2 years. She earn approximately 5000 PHP a month. She was encouraged to join PMPC to gain access to financial support, improve her living situation and enhance her business abilities. She successfully repaid her previous loan of 10000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to expand her business. She has a new loan of 15000 PHP also from PMPC, so this will be the 3rd cycle of loans from PMPC. This loan will be used as additional capital to purchase tools for the shop. The business helps to improve the general living conditions of the P. family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.name: Téning

texts.fr: Téning T. est âgée de 58 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de WALIDANE depuis 5 ans et y a bénéficié de 10 prêts qu'elle a bien gérés et remboursés. Elle possède d'une table au marché où elle vend divers produits alimentaires tels que du piment séché, des œufs frais, du sel, du poisson frais etc. Son objectif est l'achèvement de sa maison en construction.
texts.en:
Téning T. is 58 years old, married and has four children. She has been a member of the village bank in WALIDANE for five years and has had ten loans which she has managed well and repaid. She has a stall in the market where she sells diverse food products such as dried peppers, fresh eggs, salt, fresh fish etc. Her aim is to finish the construction of her house.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen her business
