loans.name: Chen

texts.en: Chen P., 48, is married and lives with her five children in Takeo Province, Cambodia.  P. has a business weaving Cambodia traditional silk, earning an income of US $3 per day. She has been doing this business since 2004. Her husband raises ducks to produce eggs for sale, earning US $3 per day. P. and her family members try to work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family. And they are seeking to improve their businesses as well as to take care of the daily necessary expenses. Therefore, P. is requesting a loan of US $1,000 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the loan to buy more ducks to raise for their eggs. This is her first loan from CREDIT.

loans.name: Jose Irnel

texts.en:
Mr. Jose Irnel G. comes from Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. He is forty years old and married with three children. Jose Irnel operates a sari-sari (variety) store, though his main source of income comes from his boarding house. He has managed his store for almost two years and earns approximately $135 a month.

In 2009, he joined PMPC to gain access to financial support and to improve his living situation and his ability to be engaged in business activities. He successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP. This will be his 3rd loan from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue to expand his business and also to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.name: Astou

texts.fr: Astou N. est une femme de 39 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 10 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois de 12 ans et demi et a une bonne expérience dans son domaine d'activité qu'est l'élevage de mouton. ses revenus lui permettent de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Astou N. is a 39-year old woman who is married and has ten children. She has been a member of the Village Bank for twelve and a half years and has good experience in her business domain which is the rearing of sheep. Her income will allow her to contribute to the improvement of her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

She plans to use this money to expand her business and to own a barber shop as well.

Rosa is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her thirteenth from PMPC. loans.name: Ke

texts.en:
Ke Y., 54, is a married woman and the mother of eight children. She now has two grown sons who work in building houses in Phnom Penh and another son who is a worker in the rubber plantation. Her sons provide their small incomes to contribute to the family. Ke Y. has a partner in her husband, Bun Vorn, who is 60 years of age and a construction foreman.

To earn a living, Ke Y. owns a small store next to her house where she operates a grocery business. She built a new house a year ago but the construction process is not entirely completed due to the lack of money. Therefore, Ke Y. requested a loan to be used to finish building her new house.

loans.use: To finish building her new house

loans.name: Fatou Ablaye

texts.fr: Fatou Ablaye F. est une femme de 55 ans, elle est veuve avec 3 enfants en charge. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 5 ans. Son activité consiste à acheter des bœufs et moutons, de les engraisser et de les revendre au bout de 4 ou 5 mois. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de renforcer son niveau d'épargne et de prendre partiellement en charge ses enfants.
texts.en:
Fatou Ablaye F. is a 55-year old woman who is a widow and has three children in her care. She has been a member of the Village Bank for five years. Her business consists of buying oxen and sheep, fattening them and reselling them after four to five months. Her profits will allow her to boost her savings and to share responsibility for her children.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen her livestock selling business

loans.name: Rose

texts.fr: Rose S. est une femme de 40 ans, elle célibataire sans enfants mais a deux enfants de ses proches en charge. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 5 ans et a une bonne expérience en matière de crédit pour en avoir bénéficié 10 fois de suite. Elle fait de la broderie de draps de lit qu'elle vend, elle vend également des chaussures. Ses revenus lui permettent de prendre en charge la santé et la nourriture des enfants qu'on lui a confiés.
texts.en:
Rose S. is a 40-year old woman, who is single and has no children of her own, but has two of her close relations' children in her care. She has been a member of the Village Bank for five years and has good borrowing experience in that she has had ten consecutive loans. She embroiders bed sheets which she sells, and she also sells shoes. Her income will allow her to take care of the children's health and food, a responsibility which has been entrusted to her.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen her investment capital

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa C. is from the village of Antipolo. She is 48 years old, married, and has nine children. Five of her children are adults and the remaining four are students. To make a living, Luisa owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Luisa has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 1,800 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Luisa joined Kiva partner PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Luisa is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be her second from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To purchase breeder hogs

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea C., 61, is married and lives with her two children in Takeo province, Cambodia. C. has a business weaving traditional Cambodian silk, and earns an income of $5 USD per day. She has been engaged in this business since 2004. C.'s husband is a farmer, earning $3 USD per day. C. and her family members work hard to help each other attain a good standard of living for the family. They are seeking to improve their businesses as well as meet their daily expenses. Therefore, C. is requesting a loan of $1,200 USD from Kiva partner, CREDIT. She wants to use her loan to buy more raw silk to produce traditional Cambodian silk for new and existing customers. This is her first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy more raw silk to produce silk products

loans.name: Nogoye

texts.fr: Nogoye N. est âgée de 45 ans, elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant en charge, par ailleurs 4 autres  lui sont confiés par des parents et des proches. Elle est membre de banc Villageois depuis 3 ans. Elle fait la broderie de draps de lit qu'elle vend, elle vend également de l'encens fabriqué artisanalement. Son objectif est de renforcer son épargne et de prendre en charge ses enfants.
texts.en:
Nogoye N. is 45 years old, married and has one child of her own; furthermore she has four other children who have been entrusted to her care by close relatives. She has been a member of the Village Bank for three years. She embroiders bed sheets which she sells, and she also sells incense which is produced by craftsmen. Her aim is to boost her savings and to take care of her children.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen her investment capital

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Mrs. Nena P. is from Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 55 years old, married, and has six children. To make a living, Nena and her husband operate a business making furniture and fixtures. They have been engaged in this business for over four years and earn approximately 28,000 PHP per month from these activities.
Nena joined Kiva partner PMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 35,000 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used to purchase materials for their business. Now, Nena is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for their business. They need additional capital because they have a lot of customers who are willing to make purchases but their capital is not sufficient.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As additional capital for their furniture business

loans.name: Maguete

texts.fr: Maguette F. est une femme de 53 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants. elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 5 ans. Elle embouche des bœufs et des mouton, cette activité lui offre la possibilité de renforcer son niveau d'épargne et de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Maguette F. is a 53-year old woman who is married with six children. She has been a member of the Village Bank for five years. She fattens oxen and sheep, and this business gives her the possibility to boost her savings and to contribute to the improvement of her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen her livestock selling business

loans.name: Eangeline

texts.en: Eangeline R. is from the village of Poblacion, Oroquieta City. She is 52 years old, is widowed, and has three adult children. Eangeline owns and operates a hog-raising business. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Eangeline joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Eangeline is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Celeste

texts.en:
Celeste B. is from the village of Dicayas. She is 29 years old. Celeste is married and has two children.  The elder child is school age while the other child is an infant.  

To make a living, Celeste owns a service-based business where the main source of income is primarily from providing transportation services such as motor cab in the local community. Celeste has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2006, Celeste joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Celeste has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase construction materials for house repair. Celeste is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used for the same purpose in continuation of the previous project. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Celeste from PMPC, and this is her second time with KIVA. She plans to give her family a comfortable shelter in which to live. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for house repair

loans.name: Allyn

texts.en:
Allyn L. is from the village of Toril. She is 38 years old. Allyn is married and has two school age children. 

To make a living, Allyn owns a flower shop business in which she sells flowers to the local community.  She also owns a "habal-habal" (motorcycle transport) business & sari-sari (convenience store) business.  Allyn has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Allyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Allyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Allyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offerings

loans.name: Maï

texts.fr: Maï K. est une femme âgée de 58 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants. Elle es membre de Banc Villageois de puis 5 ans. elle fait de l'embouche ovine. Son objectif est de renforcer son niveau d'épargne  et d'aider à la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Maï K. is a 58 year-old married mother of 7. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois for 5 years. She makes a living through rearing and fattening sheep. Her aim is to put money aside for savings and play an active role in providing for her family.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding her current business

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom M., 66, is married and lives with his three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. M. is in the agriculture sector and grows vegetables, earning an income of $1 USD per day. He has been in this business since 2005. His wife sells sticky rice, earning $3 USD per day. The family is also assisted by his three children who are workers at a garment factory. 

M. and his family members try to work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family.  They are seeking to improve their businesses as well as to help with the daily necessary expenses. Therefore, M. is requesting for loan of US $1000 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. He wants to use the loan to buy more sticky rice to stock for sale. This is his second loan from CREDIT. (M. is pictured with her husband)

loans.use: buy more sticky rice to stock for sale

loans.name: Ou

texts.en:
Ou V., 58, is married and lives with her two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is in the business of weaving Cambodian traditional silk, earning an income of US$6.60 per day. She has been in this business since 1998. Her husband is a farmer raising livestock at home on his own plot of farmland, earning US$0.60 per day. V. is shown with her husband in the photo.

V. and her family members try to work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family. And they are seeking to improve their businesses as well, so as to provide for the necessary daily expenses. Therefore, V. is requesting for a loan of US$1,100 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw silk to produce Cambodian traditional silk for her new and existing customers. This is her first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy more raw silk to weave

loans.name: Fatou Ndiolé

texts.fr: Fatou Ndiolé N. est âgée de 54 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 4 ans. Elle achète des moutons, les engraisse pendant au moins trois mois et les revend. Cette activité lui procure des bénéfices qui lui permettent de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie familiales
texts.en:
Fatou Ndiolé N. is a 54 year-old married mother of two. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois for four years. She purchases sheep, fattens them, and then sells them on after three months. This enterprise generates profits that enable her to contribute actively to improving her family’s quality of life.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improving her livestock business

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou D. est une femme de 42 ans, elle es mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est membre du banc Villageois de PALENE depuis 3 ans et y a bénéficié de 6 prêts. elle fait de la transformation et vente d'huile d'arachide. Ses revenus lui permettent de renforcer son niveau d'épargne et de participer à la prise charge familiale.
texts.en:
Fatou D., 42, is married and the mother of 5 children. She has been a member of the Village Bank of PALENE for three years and has received 6 loans. She extracts and sells peanut oil. Her income allows her to put aside more savings and help support the family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: bolster her little oil-making business

loans.name: Marcilisa

texts.en:
Marcilisa L. is from the village of Tugas, Baliangao Misamis Occidental in the Philippines. She is 53 years old, married, and has 8 adult-age children. To earn a living, Marcilisa owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector. More specifically, she is engaged in banana production and hog raising. Marcilisa has been in this line of business for 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP ($125) per month on account of these activities.

In 2000, Marcilisa joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) to gain access to financial services. As a result, she was able to engage in business activities and to improve her standard of living. Notably, Marcilisa has already successfully repaid a prior loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. The previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Marcilisa is now requesting another loan, also in the amount of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to expand her operations.

About PMPC: PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor by using the Grameen micro-lending model.

loans.use: To expand and improve her banana/hog-raising business

loans.name: Maria Linda

texts.en:
Maria Linda is from the village of Tinago, Tugas Baliangao, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines. She is 40 years old, married, and has 3 school-age children. To earn a living, Maria Linda owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector. More specifically, she runs a general goods store, where she sells items used by local community members on a daily basis. Maria Linda has been engaged in her business for 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP ($125) per month on account of these activities.

In 2003, Maria Linda joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) to gain access to financial services. In turn, she was able to engage in business activities and to improve her standard of living. Notably, Maria Linda recently repaid a prior loan in the amount of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Maria Linda is now requesting another loan, this time in the amount of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to provide additional working capital. This loan would be the fifth loan taken out by Maria Linda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business as a result of the loan proceeds to improve and expand her business.

About PMPC: PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor by using the Grameen micro-lending model.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional goods

loans.name: Se

texts.en:
Se S. is a 31-year-old married woman living with her husband and child in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Since 2007, Se has been employed at a local garment factory in the city, earning an income of $2 per day. Her husband, pictured, is an ice cream seller. Se and her family members work hard and help each other to ensure that their family maintains a good standard of living.

She would like to strengthen her family's earning power to better cover their daily living expenses. Therefore, S. is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,000 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She would like to use the loan proceeds to purchase a new motorbike and an ice cream container in order to expand and improve her husband's current business. This would be her first loan through CREDIT.

loans.use: To expand and improve her husband's business by purchasing a new motorbike and an ice cream container

loans.name: Genara

texts.en:
Genara is a 60-year-old married woman from Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. She has one child. To earn a living, Genara manages her garden with the help and support of her husband. This agricultural work serves as their main source of income. Genara notes that she has been engaged in this line of business for almost three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP ($125) per month in doing so.

Genara joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) to gain access to financial services. As a result, she was able to engage in business activities and to improve her family's standard of living. Notably, Genara recently repaid her previous loan in the amount of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This prior loan was used to expand their garden; to illustrate, the loan proceeds were used to plant corn and other vegetables which are in high demand in their region. She is now seeking a fourth loan from PMPC, this time in the amount of 7,000 PHP ($175), which would be used to build a bigger house for her family and to buy land for the expansion of their garden.

About PMPC: PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor by using the Grameen micro-lending model.

loans.use: To improve her family's house and to expand her agricultural business

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea B. is from the village of San Vicente. She is 54 years old, married, and has five children. Three of her children are adults, while the other two are currently students. To earn a living, Andrea owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, making and selling food. Primarily, her income is derived from sales of snacks and other food products to her local community members. Andrea has been engaged in this business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month on account of these activities.

In 2006, Andrea joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) to gain access to financial services. As a result, she was able to engage in business activities and to improve her family's standard of living. Notably, Andrea recently repaid a prior loan in the amount of 14,500 PHP from PMPC. Andrea is now requesting another loan, this time in the amount of 14,000 PHP ($325), which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make snacks and other delicacies for sale. This loan would be the seventh loan taken out by Andrea from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business as a result of the loan to improve and expand her business and to pay for her kids' education.

About PMPC: PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor by using the Grameen micro-lending model.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional ingredients

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn P. is from the village of Libertad Bajo, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Jocelyn owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty-one years and earns approximately 4,600 PHP a month. In 2005, Jocelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase pig feed and other supplies. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. This loan will be her 9th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Louise

texts.fr: Louise D. est une femme de 62 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 10 enfants dont 5 en charge. Son objectif est de développer un petit commerce de draps de lit afin de générer de profits qui lui permettront de participer à la prise en charge familiale et de subvenir à ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Louise D., 62, is married and the mother of 10 children, of whom 5 are still in her care. Her goal is to grow a little business selling bedsheets so that she can generate income that will allow her to help support her family and cover her own personal needs.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: bolster her little business selling bedsheets

loans.name: Seoun

texts.en:
Seoun P., 31, is married and lives with her two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is in business as a recycler, earning an income of US$3 per day. She collects recyclable materials and old batteries from her village and has been in this business since 2005. Her husband helps her in the business and does the same job, earning US$3 per day.

P. and her family members try to work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family. And they are seeking to improve their businesses as well so as to provide for the necessary daily expenses. Therefore, P. is requesting a loan of US$800 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the loan to purchase cows to help plow the rice field. This is her first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy cows to help plow the rice field

loans.name: Téning

texts.fr: Téning F. est une femme de 58 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 5 ans. Son objectif est de développer son activité de transformation de céréales locaux et de vente de jus naturels. Cette activité lui permet de renforcer ses épargnes de prendre ses besoins en charge.
texts.en:
Téning F., 58, is married and the mother of two children. She has been a member of the Village Bank for 5 years. Her goal is to grow her little business processing local cereals and selling natural juices. This business allows her to save more money and support herself.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: grow her working capital

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Presently, K. operates her own small handicraft business, mainly weaving rattan baskets and cupboards. She has a son who assists her weaving and selling rattan. K. has requested a loan of US $1000. She will use half of her loan to buy a trailer-motor in order to deliver her products to sell. With the remaining loan, she will buy a small grilling-rice machine to provide a service. 

K., 60 years old, is a good mother blessed with six children. (K. was not available when the photo was taken so her son is shown instead.) Half of her children are married and the remaining three are single. They all work at different occupations. K. was married and her husband died of senility many years ago.

loans.use: To buy a trailer-motor in order to deliver her products

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Marilou P. is from the village of Libertad Bajo, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old, is married, and has six school-aged children. Marilou owns and operates a business selling coconuts in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,200 PHP a month. In 2006, Marilou joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. Marilou is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 7th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Fatou Aliou

texts.fr: Fatou Aliou F. est une femme de 63 ans, elle est veuve sans enfant. Elle est membre du banc villageois de PALENE depuis 4 ans. Elle développe une activité d'embouche bovine. son objectif est de renforcer ses épargne et de subvenir à ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Fatou Aliou F., 63, is a widow and childless. She has been a member of the Village Bank of PALENE for four years. She wishes to expand her little business fattening cattle. Her goal is to save more and to support herself.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: grow her working capital

loans.name: Lunida

texts.en:
Mrs. Lunida P., 44 years of age, is married and is a resident of Maquilao, Tangub City. She is blessed with seven children, mostly of adolescent age.

Lunida’s husband is a fisherman and, because of the condition of this business in the past, they felt financial hardships in supporting their family. To help her husband, Lunida decided to engage in fish-vending. For ten years, she was able to generate income from her business and now she is earning an average net income of not less than 2,000 PHP a month.

As a first-time borrower, Lunida is given a privilege of obtaining PHP 4,000 to add to the capital of her fish-vending business. Her dreams in life are to be able to send her children to school and to someday have a fish stand.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her fish-vending business

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en: Mrs. Wilma A. is from the village of Locus, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is married and is 51 years old. Mrs. A. owns and operates a business selling coconuts in the local community and earns 3,000 PHP monthly. In 2007, Mrs. A. joined PMPC to gain access to its programs and services. She is requesting a new loan of 10,500 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra D. is from Gala, Ozamiz City. She is 39 years old, is married, and has seven adult-aged children. Alejandra owns and operates a business planting and harvesting ginger for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over ten years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Alejandra joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. Alejandra is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Mrs. Rosalie D. is from the village of Lucos, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 26 years old, is married, and is blessed with two infant children.

Rosalie owns and operates a business providing transportation services as shown in the photo. She is shown with her husband and one of her children.

In 2008, Rosalie joined PMPC to gain financial assistance. She is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital in purchasing another motorcycle. She wants to earn additional income by having another motorcycle for hire.

Rosalie wishes to save for their future and for the education of her children.

loans.use: To purchase another motorcycle for hire

loans.name: Aïsatou

texts.fr: Aïssatou F. est une femme de 46 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de PALENE depuis 4 ans. Elle fait de l'embouche bovine, une activité qui lui procure des bénéfices lui permettant de participer à la prise en charge familiale et de renforcer le niveau de son épargne.
texts.en:
Aïssatou F., 46, is married and the mother of 5 children. She has been a member of the Village Bank of PALENE for four years. She works at fattening cattle, a business from which she draws income that allows her to help support the family and also put aside more in savings.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: grow her working capital

loans.name: Eng

texts.en:
Mrs. Eng L. currently weaves rattan baskets and wooden beds for sale. She sells her finished products to buyers who come directly to her house. She makes many sets of baskets before selling out. Eng L. has a partner in her husband, who helps her in running the entire business. 

The couple has four teenage children; all of whom go to school or work as temporary laborers. Eng L. has been very busy at her business due to there being many clients, and recently she has gotten a lot of orders from her customers. Because she lacks capital, Eng L. is looking for a loan to purchase raw materials to make enough products to fulfill her customers' needs. 

(Mrs. Eng L.'s husband is pictured.)

loans.use: To purchase raw materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: grow her working capital

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon B. is from the village of Libertad Alto, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Corazon owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling gasoline in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over fourteen years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Corazon joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. Corazon is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 6th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Aïssatou

texts.fr: Aïssatou N. est âgée de 42 ans, elle es mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle est membre de banc Villageois de puis 4 ans et demi. Elle est teinturière, elle achète du tissu blanc le teint pour revendre. Ses revenus lui permettent de prendre en charge ses besoins personnels et de renforcer le niveau de son épargne.
texts.en:
Aïssatou N. is 42 years old, married, and has 2 children. She has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" (Village loan group) for 4 and a half years. She is a dyer, and buys white fabric to dye for resale. Her income allows her to provide for herself and raise the level of her savings.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her self-financing capability

loans.name: Bin

texts.en:
Mrs. Bin P., 38 years old, stays at home to build traditional rattan baskets for sale. She spends a few days finishing a set of rattan and is able to earn around $3 per day. She has given birth to five children, two of whom are employed. The other three attend school. 

She also relies on the income from her husband. He is a domestic animal trader. He buys oxen or horses at reasonable prices to resell at a profit, earning an average $5 a day. Bin P. saw that the animal sale business brings a good income for her family, so she hopes to enlarge the business by requesting a loan from Kiva through HKL.

loans.use: To enlarge the animal sale business.

loans.name: Jocelyn Vale

texts.en:
Jocelyn Vale P. is a 30-year-old mother with the good faith to get out from under the ties of poverty. She is the mother of an only child, Christian John, who is a minor. Jocelyn is married to Reynaldo, a laborer, but his salary is not enough for their daily expenditures.

As a mother with big dreams, in 2007 Jocelyn joined ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.), a micro-finance institution and Kiva partner in the Philippines. Since then, she started a variety store and it has really helped them to meet their needs. Her business is growing because the people in her neighborhood like her products and find what they need in her store instead of going to the town proper.

Now on her seventh loan, Jocelyn proposes the amount of 25,000 pesos to pay for cases of soft drinks, liquor, rice, and groceries for her store.

Jocelyn dreams of growing her variety store into a mini-grocery store and expanding it to other places. She hopes that, with the help of ASHI and Kiva, she can reach her goal to step out of poverty and have a good living. She now feels very glad about her work and the services of ASHI and Kiva. They offer her big opportunities to make her dreams come true.

loans.use: To buy cases of soft drinks, liquor, rice and groceries for her variety store

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr: Amy S. est une femme de 43 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 3 ans. Elle fait de l'embouche bovine et ovine, une activité qui lui génère des bénéfices lui permettant de participer à la prise en charge de sa famille et de renforcer ses épargnes.
texts.en:
Amy S. is a 43-year-old married mother of 4 children. She has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" (Village loan group) for 3 years. She raises cattle and sheep, and this activity generates a profit that allows her to take part in providing for her family and strengthen her savings.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her investment capacity

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Kim H. is a rattan basket producer. She is 57 years old and is a married mother, caring for three kids who are students in the local public school. Another two of her children are married and live away from home.  

Since 2006, Kim H. and her husband have owned a small rattan basket production business. This couple also orders rattan items in bulk from other producers and takes them to sell door-to-door across the province. They always take a week or two weeks to sell their products. 

Kim H. always needs to pay a lot of money for a taxi for traveling anywhere. She wants to cut down this fee, so she would like to ask for a loan of $600 to purchase a used motorcycle for her transportation needs.

loans.use: To purchase a used motorcycle.

loans.name: Febelita

texts.en:
Febelita B. was born in the town of Tanay, Rizal, in the Philippines. She is 46 years old and is married to a fisherman, Edgardo. She and her husband have three children: two in college and one in high school.

Febelita and her husband come from very poor families. They realize that their lack of education has led to their poverty, and they want a better life for their children. The couple has a strong belief not to be affected by poverty; instead they are inspired to work hard for their children.

Febelita joined ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap Inc.), a Kiva partner in the Philippines, in 1995; since then, she has grown to love the organization. ASHI helped her in the start-up of a business, enabling her to support her husband in their daily expenditures.

Febelita and her husband have been in the fishing business for more than ten years. She now proposes that her eighth loan of Php 25,000 be used to continue their fishing business with the support of her husband. She will purchase assorted equipment for her fishing business like fishing net, rope, and bamboo. The remaining loan will be use to pay for a cow for additional income.

Febelita hopes that this business will be the source of income to finance the needs of her family and to provide a comfortable house to live in. She is very thankful to all members of ASHI for educating her, especially in dealing with other people, generating an ability to accept new challenges in her life, and helping her to achieve her dreams and improve their standard of living.

Febelita is grateful to the ASHI-Kiva partnership for supporting people like her who want to get out of poverty and get ahead. She hopes that the partnership continues this way for a long time and helps many poor families.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for her fishing business and to buy a cow for additional income

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa S. est âgée 41 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de PALENE depuis 3 ans. Elle fait de l'embouche Bovine depuis plus de 2 ans. Grâce à cette activité elle parvient à subvenir à ses besoins personnels et à participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Awa S. is a 41-year-old married mother of 5 children. She has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" (Village loan group) of Palene for 3 years. She has raised cattle for more than 2 years. Thanks to this activity, she is able to meet her own needs and participate in the improvement of her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her self-financing capability

loans.name: Koeuth

texts.en: Koeuth K. is a 49-year-old and a resident of Kompong Tom province, where she earns a living by raising many pigs in a stall next to her house.  In addition, she has a small plot of land where her husband plants different kinds of crops, including potatoes and rice. Koeuth K. has three school-aged kids and another two who are employed. Due to the fact that the pig-breeding trade is very profitable, Koeuth K. would like a loan to buy pig feed and more piglets to raise.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and more piglets to raise.

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr: Amy G. est une femme de 48 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de PALENE de 3 ans et demi. l'objectif de son crédit est de renforcer sa boutique en marchandises diverses tel que du riz, du sucre, de l'huile etc.. afin de réaliser des bénéfices qui lui permettront de contribuer à la prise en charge de sa famille
texts.en:
Amy G. is a 48-year-old married mother of 4 children. She has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" (Village loan group) of Palene for 3 and a half years. The goal of this loan is to increase her store's stock of various merchandise such as rice, sugar, oil, etc. in order to realize a profit that will allow her to contribute to taking care of her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen and develop her commercial activity

loans.name: Amy Tawa

texts.fr: Amy Tawa D. est une femme de 48 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 8 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 3 ans et demi. elle fait de l'embouche bovine et ovine, une activité qui lui génère des revenus lui permettant de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie familiales.
texts.en:
Amy Tawa D. is a 48-year-old married mother of 8 children. She has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" (Village loan group) for 3 and a half years. She raises cattle and sheep, and this business generates an income that allows her to participate in improving her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen her business

loans.name: Ndella

texts.fr: Ndella D. est une femme de 55 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de PALENE depuis 3 ans et a eu 6 expériences avec le crédit. Elle fait de l'embouche bovine. Elle soutien son mari dans la pris en charge de la famille par rapport à la nourriture et la santé.
texts.en:
Ndella D. is a 55-year-old married mother of 7 children. She has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" (Village loan group) of Palene for 3 years and has had 6 previous loan experiences. She raises cattle. She supports her husband in providing for the family's food and health needs.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen and develop her business

loans.name: Ndiolé

texts.fr: Ndiolé Y. est une femme de 45 ans, elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant. Elle est membre du banc Villageois de PALENE depuis 2 ans et demi. Elle fait de l'embouche bovine, une activité qui lui génère de revenus lui permettant de participer aux différentes charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Ndiolé Y. is a 45-year-old married mother of one child. She has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" (Village loan group) of Palene for 2 and half years. She raises cattle, and this business generates an income that allows her to participate in providing for various family needs.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen and develop her business

loans.name: Sokhna

texts.fr: Sokhna S. est une femme de 30 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Depuis 2 ans et demi elle est membre du Banc Villageois de PALENE. Elle fait de l'embouche bovine et ovine. Son activité lui procure des revenus qui lui permettent de participer à la prise en charge financière de la famille.
texts.en:
Sokhna S. is a 30-year-old married mother of 4 children. For 2 and a half years, she has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" (Village loan group) of Palene. She raises cattle and sheep. Her business provides her with an income that allows her to participate in taking financial care of her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen and develop her business

loans.name: Ikhtilat

texts.en: Ikhtilat I. is a 49-year-old man who sells turkeys and chickens in the small village of Agsu city. He is married and has three children.  Ikhtilat has four years of experience in poultry breeding. He needs 1200 AZN to purchase more poultry and increase his income.

loans.use: purchase more poultry

loans.name: Elshan

texts.en:
Elshan M. is a hardworking, enterprising man who started his business seven years ago so that he could have a better future. He buys and sells foodstuffs and he has an extensive clientele. Elshan understands the business very well so he has had great success. He hopes to keep expanding the business and increasing sales daily. He hopes his business will help him improve his situation and his quality of life. 

Elshan is asking for 1600 Azerbaijani manats to stock his store now that demand is increasing day by day. He is very grateful for your support in helping him expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou D. est âgée de 53 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants. elle est membre du Banc Villageois de WALIDANE depuis 3 ans. Elle fait de la teinture et vend des parfums. Son objectif est de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie et de renforcer son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
Fatou D. is a 53-year-old married mother of 6 children. She has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" (Village loan group) of Walidane for 3 years. She dyes clothing and sells perfume. Her goal is to participate in improving her living conditions and to increase the level of her savings.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen and develop her commercial activity

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou D. est une femme de 50 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants. Elle est très expérimentée en matière de crédit pour y avoir accédé à 13 fois de suite. Avec son prêt elle acheter des des moutons les engraisse et les revendre. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de renforcer ses épargnes et de participer à la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Fatou D. is a 50-year-old married mother of 7 children. She is very experienced in matters of credit, having obtained 13 loans in succession. With this loan, she buys sheep, raises them, and resells them. Her profits allow her to strengthen her savings and participate in taking care of her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her self-financing capability

loans.name: Amrulla

texts.en:
Amrulla K. is 44 years old. He is married and has five children. Amrulla has been working in agriculture for more than 20 years, since he was young. He has been breeding sheep for more than 20 years and he is trying to improve the breed in order to increase his prices. He invests time and money for the feed and medicines that the animals require. Amrulla keeps going thanks to the help and enthusiasm of his five children who, along with his wife, help him care for the animals. 

Amrulla needs a loan of 1600 Azerbaijani manats to buy more sheep to expand his business. With your help, this will be possible.

loans.use: To purchase 15 sheep and fodder

loans.name: Satou

texts.fr: Satou F. est âgée de 43 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 10 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de PALENE et y a bénéficié de 10 prêts qu'elle a bien gérés et remboursés. Elle fait de l'embouche bovine et les revenus générés par son activité lui permet de participer à la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Satou F. is 43 years old, married and mother of ten children. She is a member of the ‘Banc Villageois’ loan group of PALENE, and was granted ten loans that were used well and reimbursed. She fattens cattle for a living, and the income generated by this activity allows her to participate in supporting family expenses.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Reinforce and develop her activity

loans.name: Marème

texts.fr: Marème D. est une femme de 54 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SILANE depuis 8 ans et y a reçu 16 prêts de suite et n'a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. L'objectif de son crédit est de renforcer sa boutique en marchandises. Elle y vend du riz, du thé, de l'huile, du sucre etc.. Elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Marème D. is a 54 year-old married women with six children. For the past eight years, she has been a member of the SILANE Village Bank and has repaid her 16 previous loans. The goal of this loan is to increase her shop’s inventory. She sells rice, tea, oil, sugar, etc. She works to improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen and develop her business

loans.name: Saye

texts.fr: Saye S. est âgée de 43 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est membre du Banv Villageois de PALENE d'où elle a contracté 7 fois de suite du crédit. Elle fait de l'embouche ovine et vend de l'huile et des arachides. Elle participe à la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Saye S. is a 43 year-old, married woman with five children. She is a member of the PALENE Village Bank and has previously taken out seven loans. She engages in the fattening of sheep and sells oil and peanuts. She helps to meet the needs of the family.

Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen and develop her business

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou D. est une femme de 35 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SILANE depuis 4 ans et y a bénéficié de 8 prêts. Elle fait de la restauration, une activité qui lui génère des bénéfices lui permettant de participer aux différentes charges familiales.
texts.en:
Fatou D. is a married, 35 year-old woman with four children. For the past four years, she has been a member of the SILANE Village Bank and has been the recipient of eight loans. She works in the restaurant business. The income from her business activities goes towards meeting the needs of the family.

Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen and develop her business activities

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes F. is from the village of Misom Baliangao Misamis Occidental.  She is 56 years old, married and has 1 adult-aged child. To make a living, Lourdes owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store . Lourdes has been engaged in her business for 2 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Lourdes joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lourdes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional support the education of her son. Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used for her house repair.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model). *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase materials for her house repair

loans.name: Ezel

texts.en:
Ezel J. is from the village of Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental.  She is 28 years old, married and has 2 infant-aged children. To make a living, Ezel owns & operates a business venture of NFA retailer. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling NFA rice in the local community. Ezel has been engaged in her business for 4 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Ezel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ezel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Ezel is requesting a new loan of 35000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Ezel from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model).

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchase additional inventory & working capita

loans.name: Lach

texts.en: Lach K., 45, owns a handicraft enterprise producing rattan cupboards. She is one of the low-income people living in Kompong Tom province. She saves many sets of her items before sending them out with her husband to sell door-to-door around the community. Lach K. has been very busy at her business with many clients who need her products. Recently Lach K.'s products are in demand by her clients but she doesn’t have enough items to serve them. That is why she applied for a loan to purchase more rattans.

loans.use: To purchase more rattans

loans.name: Burged

texts.en:
Burged has lived with her husband and two daughters in the city for the past year. To help support her family, she imports meat from the countryside and sells it at the local market.

Burged purchased several tons of energy efficient fuel to stay warm in the long cold days of winter as well as to save money from fuel costs. Since using the fuel, she has noticed that it keeps her yurt (tent) warmer for a longer period of time.


About XacBank Eco Products Program:
Ulaanbaatar is the coldest capital in the world. Winter temperatures can average -20 Celsius. Sixty percent of the city population live in tents called gers, with wooden frames covered by layers of wool felt. On average, households located in the Ger Districts use 5 tons of coal and 1.5 tons of wood per year. Sixty percent of the pollution in the city during the heating season is attributed to coal burned in the Ger Districts. The bottom fifth spend as much as 40% of their monthly winter income on heating fuels.

XacBank has worked with MicroEnergy Credits to launch a line of eco-products consisting of energy efficient stoves and ger blankets, which will reduce energy consumption.

loans.use: To buy clean and energy efficient heating fuel

loans.name: San

texts.en:
San S., 35, has been spending time to cultivate a rice crop since she was single. She now has a partner in her husband, who assists her on the farm. The couple has two teenage kids who are going to school.

San S. needs a loan to buy a neighbor’s cow, which she will use to plow her farmland.

loans.use: To buy a neighbor’s cow

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.en: Adolfo B. is from the village of Canitoan, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 43 years old. Adolfo is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Adolfo provides motorcycle services to transport passengers in the local community. Adolfo has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Adolfo joined HSPFI, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Adolfo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. Adolfo is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand the services he provides. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Adolfo from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services provided

location.town: Canito-an, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Leah

texts.en: Leah O. is from the village of Libertad Alto, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old. Leah is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Leah sells a variety of dry goods. Leah has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3,200 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2007, Leah joined PMPC, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leah has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Leah is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Leah from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Helenita

texts.en: Helenita E. is from the village of Carmen, Cagayan de oro City. She is 40 years old. Helenita is widowed and has one adult child. To make a living, Helenita runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Helenita has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2008, Helenita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helenita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Helenita is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Helenita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Carmen, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Hin

texts.en:
B., age 25, is a married man and the father of a child who attends the local public school.

B. is a carpenter for small local firm. He is also hired by villagers to build their new wooden houses, earning $4 each day. In addition, he built a small stall behind his house where his wife raises a few pigs for extra profit.

B. wants to buy a plot of neighbor’s land in a good location for farming, but he doesn’t have money yet to buy it. He is therefore asking for a loan to purchase the farmland on which he will plant a variety of crops.

loans.use: To purchase a piece of farmland

loans.name: Rosemary Banuelo's Group

texts.en:
Rosemary B. is from the village of Canubay. She is 35 years old. Rosemary is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 'Rosemary Banuelo's group'.

Rosemary is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Rosemary owns & operates a dried fish vending business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling dried fish in the local community. Aside from dried fish, she also sells peanut butter. Rosemary has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2000, Rosemary joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosemary has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Rosemary is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 16th loan taken out by Rosemary from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC:

Christy S. is from the village of Canitoan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 44 years old. Christy is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Christy owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Christy has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Christy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Christy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Christy is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Christy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

To make a living, Evelyn owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling clothing & shoes in the local community. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,800 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Evelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 8th loan taken out by Evelyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.name: Kung

texts.en:
Kung K. is 34 years of age and a resident of Kompong Tom province. In order to meet the needs of her family, Kung K. sells a few grocery items from her home. She has four years of experience in this business and is earning over $9 per day. 

Kung K. was married and divorced her husband when her child was very young. Recently she has sold out of nearly all the grocery items from her store. She wants to acquire more items to continue selling but she lacks money to increase her inventory. Thus, she looks for assistance from Kiva through HKL with a loan of US $1000. She will accumulate a quantity of merchandise for her store.

loans.use: To restock merchandise

loans.name: Jeany

texts.en:
Mrs. Jeany P. is from the village of Lapasan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 40 years old. Jeany is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Jeany owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling processed foods like processed pork ('longganiza' and chorizo--sausages) as well as hot dogs. Sometimes she also sells ready-to-wear items like pants, shirts, and more in the local community. Jeany has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Jeany joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jeany has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Jeany is requesting a new loan of 23,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Jeany from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

location.town: Lapasan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is 35, married, and the mother of two children aged 17 and 20 years. Both her children go to school and she takes care of additional family members. She resides in and owns a one-roomed house where she is staying with three people. The family has access to electricity and piped water and gets three meals a day. Harriet has a stall frying chapatti (flat bread) and samosas (pastries). She incurs transport costs to and from buying wheat flour and cooking oil and peas. She works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala

Harriet works seven days a week .She receives an average of 30 customers a day and sells to all categories of people. Her greatest monthly expenses include feeding the family and monthly market dues for her business and school fees for her children. Her major business challenges are transportation of boxes of wheat and jerrycans of cooking oil.

Harriet has been in this business for five years and with MCDT for seven years, servicing her fourteenth loan, working with the same group mates. Harriet joined MCDT because it was near her home and was working with poor women. She wants to use this loan to buy more jerrycans of cooking oil and cartons of baking flour. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and starting a bakery.

loans.use: To buy more jerrycans of cooking oil and cartons of baking flour

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan M. is currently in the business of designing bedsheets and sewing pairs of trousers to sell and is requesting a loan to stock more materials to design and sell. Juan is 36 years old and is married to a husband who is a driver. She has 4 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent out.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

loans.use: stock more materials to design and  sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda S. is from the village of Rizal, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 54 years old, married and has 3 children. To make a living, Erlinda owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products in the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for 2 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Erlinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 12th loan taken out by Erlinda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.
