With this loan, she wants to buy rice, vegetables, sugar, and soft drinks,to increase her stock. In the future, she wants to buy a van to transport her merchandise and to improve her house.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables, rice, sugar, soft drinks

loans.name: Mbayang

texts.fr: Mabyabg M. est âgée de 43 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 1 an et demi. Elle fait du porte à porte pour vendre divers produits tels que de l'arachide, de l'huile d'arachide, du savons etc. Son objectif est de renforcer ses épargnes et de contribuer au bien-être familiale.
texts.en:
Mabyabg M. is 43 years old, married, and the mother of seven children.  She has been a member of Banc Villageois for a year and a half.  Mabyabg goes from door to door selling a variety of goods, such as peanuts, peanut oil, soaps, etc.  Her goal is to bolster her savings and to contribute to the family's well-being.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering and advancing her work

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy soft drinks and water for resale and ice to cool the beverages

loans.name: José María

texts.es:
En 1990 el señor José María decidió dedicarse a la agricultura. Este inició en este negocio ya que antes había trabajado como negociador de cosechas y conocía bien el movimiento.

Actualmente este seños de 47 años junto con uno de sus hijos siembra cinco manzanas de las cuales 2 son de maíz, 1 de yuca y 2 de frijoles. Además comercializa cosechas por ello él invertirá este crédito en la compra de tamarindo que es lo que está en flota para luego venderlo en el mercado.
texts.en:
In 1990 Mr. Jose Maria decided to work in farming. He began this business because he had worked as a food broker previously and was very familiar with the process. Currently this 47-year old gentleman, along with one of his sons, plants 5 fields: 2 are corn, 1 is yucca, and the other 2 are beans. Besides these commercial crops, he will invest this loan in purchasing tamarind, which is in season, to later sell in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a crop of tamarind

loans.name: Carlos Gerardo

texts.es:
Carlos Gerardo M. G., tiene la edad de 36 años, esta casado, y tiene 3 hijos, que junto con su esposa son su mayor prioridad, sus hijos tienen 13,12 y 9 años respectivamente. El crédito lo quiere para mejorar su taller de soldadura y para la compra de materiales para trabajar, tiene un local donde realiza sus trabajos de soldadura y pintura. Es la primera vez don Carlos se financia con  FUDECOSUR, el manifiesta que el comité de crédito le ha ayudado mucho y le brindaron muchas facilidades. El espera que con este proyecto crezca y pueda mejorar su capacidad en los trabajos y así aumentar sus ingresos, además desea superarse como persona,  y así poder en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y tener una mejor estabilidad económica.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Carlos Gerardo M. Garcia is 36 years old, married, and has three children, who are his greatest priority, along with his wife. His children are 13, 12, and 9 years old, respectively. He wants this credit in order to improve his welding workshop and for the purchase of work materials. He has a locale where he performs welding and painting jobs. This is the first time that Carlos has financed himself through FUDECOSUR, and he states that the credit committee has helped him a lot and has made things easy for him. With this project, he hopes to grow and improve his work capacity and therefore increase his income. Furthermore, he desires to better himself as a person, and in that way be able to provide his family a better quality of life in the future and to have better economic stability. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improvements to his welding and painting workshop

loans.name: Small Business Unit Group

texts.en: John F. is the leader of five borrowers called Small Business Unit. He is 37 years old and is married with three children aged 13 to 16 years with educational levels of 4th and 5th grade. He is a nursing student hoping to graduate next semester. John lives and sells at Rock Town UN drive, Water Side. This area has a market environment and is a crowded area close to downtown Monrovia. John's business is the sale of new clothes. He has been running this business for twelve years and hopes to own a store in the near future. John started his business by selling used clothes and his capital was 2,500 Liberian dollars. He attracts customers by selling new designs and needs this loan to purchase more clothes to sell. He dreams of educating his children to make them good future leaders. In the photo that accompanies this profile, John is the one holding the sign. S. J. is inset at lower left. About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating micro-finance institution with thirteen branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more new clothes to sell

loans.name: Jessica Elizabeth

texts.es:
Jessica Ramírez de 26 años de edad, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil, tiene en su casa con luz como servicios básicos y el agua se la van a dejar banqueros que reparten agua en su sector, su esposo trabaja como vendedor de frutas en el mercado de Paraíso.
 
Jessica empezó vendiendo tres tiras de snack poco a poco vendiendo e invirtiendo en dulces pudo poner un pequeño negocio en su casa. Ahora tiene muy surtida su tienda Jessica trabaja desde las 07h00 hasta las 21h00 todos los días de la semana. Uno de los inconvenientes que tiene es la delincuencia que hay en el sector.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, verduras, azúcar, colas para incrementar más su tienda. En el futuro quiere poner una sucursal de su tienda y poder construir mejor su casa.
texts.en:
Jessica Ramírez is 26 years old, she lives in a suburb of Paraíso de Guayaquil. She has basic services such as electricity in her home and water is delivered in her neighborhood. Her husband works selling fruits in the Paraíso market.

Jessica began selling three types of snacks, and little by little started selling and investing in sweets and was able to open a small business in her home. Today, her store is very well stocked. Jessica works from 7:00am until 9:00pm every day of the week. One of the problems that she faces is crime in her neighborhood.

With this loan, she wants to buy rice, vegetables, sugar, and sodas to increase the stock of her store. In the future, she wants to open another branch of her store and improve her house.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, oil, sodas

loans.name: Arminda Esperanza

texts.es:
la sra Arminda Esperanza M. C. tiene un puesto de venta de variedad en ropa para caballeros, damas y niños. Su negocio esta ubicado en el Boulevar de esta ciudad de Danli frente al estadio,  Arminda tiene 6 seis años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad y es notable que durante este tiempo lo ha sabido administrar.
Doña Arminda es una mujer luchadora ya que anteriormente laboraba para una fabrica de tabacos despues 
tomo la desición de dedicarse al negocio, ya que el trabajo en la fabrica le perjudicaba la salud.
Es soltera por viudes, su esposo fallecio hace 4 años y  quedo a cargo del hogar con 2 hijos que con 
esfuerzos y ganancias de su negocio les ha brindado el estudio y ahora sus hijos son profesionales. 
el año pasado con las ganancias que le genero el mismo se compro un vehiculo que lo utiliza para su negocio y ha mejorado su vivienda.
texts.en:
Arminda Esperanza M. C. has a stand where she sells a variety of clothing for men, women, and children. Her business is located on the boulevard in the city of Danli in front of the stadium. Arminda has been doing this type of work for six years. It is notable that during this time she has known how to run the business. Arminda is a fighter who previously worked for a tobacco factory. Later she made the decision to devote herself to business because working in the factory damaged her health. She is widowed, and therefore single. Her husband died four years ago, and she was left with the responsibility of a household with two children. With effort and the earnings from her business she educated her children, and they are now professionals. Last year she used the earnings she generated to buy a vehicle that she uses for her business, and she has improved her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pants, skirts, blouses, children's outfits,  underwear, sports t-shirts, socks, and ankle supports

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Canastito Group

texts.es:
El grupo Canastito está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras. La coordinadora de este grupo es la señora Rosa Adela T. C.. Ella comenzó con la venta de platanitos hace 9 años en la actualidad T. hace y distribuye platanitos a los vendedores.  

Su compañera María de los Ángeles D. G. hace ropa típica como blusas, cotonas, guayaberas, trajes de folklor etc. desde hace seis años. Mientras Teresa del Carmen R. en el 2005 decidió tener su propio negocio en el cual consiste en hacer ropa de cama y de niños.
texts.en:
The group Canastito is made up of three hard working women. Mrs. Rosa Adela T. C. is the coordinator of this group. She began selling plantains 9 years ago, and currently she prepares and distributes plantains to vendors. Her partner, Maria de los Angeles Davila Garcia, has been making typical clothing such as blouses, aprons, shirts, suits, etc. for six years. Meanwhile, in 2005, Teresa del Carmen R. decided to start her own business in which she makes bedclothes and childrens' clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make plantains

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
En el municipio El Sauce de León , la señora Luz Marina B. se dedica arduamente a laborar con el fin de llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación la que está compuesta por sus dos hijos en edades escolares. Ella se ha destacado por ser muy trabajadora y siempre ha logrado mantener su núcleo familiar.
El crédito que ella solicita lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima para elaborar alimentos con el fin de comercializarlos en su propia localidad. Ella actualmente no cuenta con la materia prima para la elaboración pero una vez que obtenga el crédito a lo inmediato hará la compra para llevar a cabo dicha actividad en su municipio.
texts.en:
In the municipality of El Sauce de León, Mrs. Luz Marina B. works very hard to provide for her home where she has two school-aged children. She is known for being a very hard worker and has always succeeding in maintaining her nuclear family. The loan that she has applied for will be invested in the purchase of food which she will cook and sell in her own restaurant. Currently she does not have all the materials she needs to cook, but once she receives the loan she will immediately buy the necessary goods to start making the food.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials to make food/meals

loans.name: Maria Felix

texts.es:
la sra. Maria Felix S. M. tiene 41 años de edad, vive en la colonia Nueva Esperanza y se dedica a la venta de pan blanco y dulce, todos los dias se levanta muy temprano para y a comprar el pan, cargar el carro y salir a vender su producto en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Danli. 
tiene la ayuda de su hijo para el manejo del carro.
Maria necesita el credito para comprar mas pan ya que los pedidos que tiene en estos momentos son muchos y no tiene capital para comprar mas pan.
se siente muy feliz porque todo le esta saliendo muy bien.
las ganancias las ocupa para el sustento de su hogar y su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Felix S. M. is 41 years old and lives in the Nueva Esperanza neighborhood. She works selling sweet bread and candies. Every day she wakes up early to buy the bread, load her car, and go to sell her products in different places around the city of Danli. Her son helps out by driving the car. Maria needs the loan to buy more bread because she has many orders, but does not have the money to buy sufficient bread. She feels happy because her business is going well. She uses her profits for the expenses of her home and family.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bread and candies

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Las Praderas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Praderas lo conforman Tania Auxiliadora A. Z., Eugenia del Carmen Gaitán C. y Elizabeth del Socorro C. tres féminas trabajadoras las cuales desean seguir trabajando y que su negocio crezca.
 
La joven A. Z. de 22 años con ayuda de sus padres cumplió su sueño pera tener su propio taller de calzado. En el trabajan arduamente ella y su hermano en la realización y comercialización del producto.

Eugenia del Carmen Gaitán C.  tiene una mini pulpería la cual desea tener más grande y surtida. Mientras Elizabeth del Socorro C. quien vende leña desea tener un tramo en el mercado.
texts.en:
The Praderas group is made up of Tania Auxiliadora A. Z., Eugenia del Carmen Gaitán C., and Elizabeth del Socorro C. three hard-working women who hope to continue working and growing their businesses. A. Z., 22 years old, achieved her dream of opening a shoe shop with her parents help. She and her brother work arduously in the shop making and selling their shoes. Eugenia del Carmen Gaitán C. has a small market which she wants to be bigger and better supplied. Meanwhile, Elizabeth del Socorro C. sells firewood and wants to have a lot in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For leather, soles, glue, nails, etc.

loans.name: María Inés

texts.es:
La señora María Ines E. se dedica desde hace 25 largos años a la actividad de crianza de ganado específicamente de cerdos llevándola a cabo en su casa de habitación donde da el alimento a los cerdos y vela por el bienestar de estos animales y al momento en que están engordados procede con el destace donde vende la carne en su localidad.
La razón por la que la señora María E. solicita el crédito es para invertir en la actividad de la crianza de cerdos por medio de la alimentación y también para la compra de ladrillos para la sala de su vivienda que tanto lo necesita y así llevar a cabo su actividad de crianza de cerdos en un lugar más cómodo para ella y para los compradores que le visitan.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Ines E. has worked for 25 long years raising livestock specifically pigs. She raises them in her house where she feeds them and cares for these animals. When they are fattened she then butchers them and sells them in her store. The reason Mrs. María E. applied for the loan is to invest in her business of raising pigs. She will buy feed and purchase bricks to redo the room in her house. These repairs will let her raise the pigs in a more comfortable way for her and for the buyers who visit her.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improvements for the store

loans.name: Dewompele #3 Group

texts.en: Kumba P. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Dewompele #3. She is 38 years old and is married with four children aged 10 to 24 years with educational level of 5th grade through university freshman student. She also cares for a grandchild. Kumba and her family lives in West Point, a very crowded and poor community close to downtown Monrovia, Liberia. She could not continue her education after 8th grade due to her developing eye problem. Kumba’s business is the sale of cosmetics for children. She buys her stock from wholesalers and sells retail in the Waterside market in downtown Monrovia. She has been running this business for six years and is hoping to own a cosmetics store in the near future. She talks to customers in a good manner in order to encourage them to continue buying from her. Kumba started by selling underwear and her capital was 700 Liberian dollars. She then raised money to get into children’s cosmetics sales. She needs this loan to purchase more cosmetics to sell. She dreams of giving her children a better education and helping them to establish themselves. In the photo that accompanies this profile, Kumba P. is the one holding the sign. Siah A. is inset at lower right. About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating micro-finance institution with thirteen branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Olman Antonio

texts.es:
Olman S. Ramirez es un caballero que se dedica con gran esfuerzo a la actividad ganadera en el municipio El Sauce de León donde da lugar a la crianza de ganado con el fin de llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación y así beneficiar a su familia compuesta por sus dos hijos en edades escolares.
Actualmente está solicitando un crédito para la compra de cinco terneros de desarrollo con un peso aproximado de 270 kilos. De esta menera logrará llevar a cabo su crianza y engorde para luego sacarle el máximo provecho a dichos terneros y así continuar con el beneficio a su familia que tanto ama.
texts.en:
Olman S. Ramirez is a gentleman who works raising cattle in the municipality of El Sauce de León. Here he raises cattle to provide for his home and benefit his family, which includes two school-aged children. Currently he is seeking a loan to buy five calves who are approximately 270 kilograms each. He will then finish raising them and fattening them to maximize the profits from the calves and thus continue to benefit his family, whom he loves so much.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of calves

loans.name: Jeanet Colinares' Group

texts.en: Jeanet C. is from the village of Dullan. She is 48 years old. Jeanet is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by PMPC, a Kiva partner. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Jeanet C.' Group. Jeanet is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Jeanet owns and operates a coconut and sari-sari (variety) store business. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting coconuts for sale. Jeanet has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2007, Jeanet joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jeanet has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Jeanet is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to pay for services to increase her crop yield. This will be the ninth loan taken out by Jeanet from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Cornelia's Group

texts.en:
Cornelia O. is from the village of San Isidro. She is 47 years old. Cornelia is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Cornelia is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Cornelia owns & operates egg retailing & pig raising businesses.The main source of income for the business comes from selling eggs in the local community. Cornelia has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Cornelia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cornelia has successfully repaid previous loans from PMPC. Cornelia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Cornelia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rosa Romilia

texts.es: La señora Rosa tiene el negocio de pulpería en su casa, el crédito lo utilizara para la compra de granos básico y otros y así poder surtir su ventecita en donde sus cliente son trabajadores del campo, ella se levanta desde las 4:30am ya que a esa hora le demandan sus productos, ella antes lavaba y planchaba y después empezó vendiendo verduras en las calles esto lo empezó con ahorros y después puso la venta pequeña y así la ido incrementando poco a poco tiene seis años de trabajar de esta manera y los dos crédito que ha tenido con CEPRODEL le ha ayudado a tener un mejor ingreso para su familia es madre de cuatro jóvenes de los cuales dos trabajan al campo y dos están estudiando de los cuales le ayudan a su mama desde horas muy temprana a atender el negocio.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa runs a small convenience store from her house. The loan will be used to buy grains and other items so she can increase her stock. Her customers are farm laborers. Rosa gets up early at 4:30am as that is the time that people need her products. In the past she did washing and ironing, and then she started selling vegetables in the streets. From this work she managed to save some money and was able to get a small stall which she gradually expanded. She did this work for six years. The two loans she has had from Kiva partner Ceprodel have helped her to earn more money for her family. Rosa has four children, two of whom do farm work, and two are students. They help their mother from early in the morning with the business.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, sugar, beans etc.

loans.name: Frieda

texts.es:
Con mucho entusiasmo en su actividad, la señora Frieda A. se dedica a la actividad de ganadería en el municipio de El Sauce en el departamento de León donde a diario da lugar a la crianza de dichos animales en su localidad donde actualmente tiene 12 años de dedicarse a esto.
El crédito que ella está solicitando lo invertirá directamente en la compra de tres vacas ya que le urge obtenerlas para proceder con la crianza y luego extraer la leche para venderla comercializándola en su localidad. Ella espera que su crédito sea otorgado y de esta manera mejorará sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Señora Frieda A. really enjoys her work raising cattle in the municipality of El Sauce, in the department of León. Everyday she takes care of the animals in the fields--she’s been doing this work for twelve years. The loan that Frieda is asking for will be used to buy three cows. She needs the money urgently so that she can get on with raising them, and eventually obtain milk which she can sell in the neighbourhood. She hopes that her request will be granted so that she can improve her own and her family’s living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Guillermina, de 38 años, es una mujer muy tranquila y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida.
La crianza de ganado es la actividad que ha realizado desde muy niña, ella fue aprendiendo este negocio de sus padres, quienes siempre se preocuparon por enseñarle una actividad con la cual pudiera defenderse sola en el futuro.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es pastear a sus animales, ya que disfruta mucho del aire libre, lleva 12 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es llevar su ganado hasta la feria dominical de la ciudad, donde vende sus reses. 
Con el tiempo, espera incrementar la cantidad de ganado que tiene actualmente, para así mejorar sus ingresos económicos.

Este es el tercer préstamo de Guillermina con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, en su banco comunal es una de las socias más cumplidas y puntuales. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más forraje (pasto) para tener bien alimentado a su ganado.
texts.en:
38-year old Guillermina is a calm mother and hard worker. She lives in her own house, and her greatest wish is to improve her quality of life. She has raised cattle ever since she was a little girl, a business that she learned from her parents who were always concerned to teach her a trade that would allow her to look after herself in the future. Guillermina most enjoys putting the animals out to pasture as she really likes being out in the fresh air. She’s been doing this work for twelve years and considers that the most difficult part is getting the cattle to the Sunday market in the city where she sells them. In the future she hopes to increase the number of cattle that she has right now so that she can earn more money. This is her third loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she is ready to repay the installments on time. In her community bank she is considered to be one of the most experienced and punctual members. With the S/.1000 she will buy more fodder (grass) so that her cattle are well fed.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fodder for her cattle

loans.name: Anais

texts.es:
Anais, de 19 años, es una joven muy trabajadora y sincera, vive en la casa de sus padres y está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro con tal de mejorar su calidad de vida.
La librería que con mucho sacrificio ha puesto Anais, se ha convertido en una de las principales de su barrio, ya que tiene muchos clientes, los cuales saben que pueden encontrar todo lo que necesitan, pues además de librería también ofrece el servicio de fotocopiado, lo cual le da una ventaja sobre su competencia. Todos los días ella se levanta muy temprano para atender, ya que sabe que mientras más horas atienda, más ganancias obtendrá.
Por otro lado, lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, de esta manera hace más amenas sus largas jornadas de trabajo. Lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que quedarse hasta altas horas de la noche en su negocio.
Con el tiempo, desea arreglar la infraestructura de su tienda para poder brindarles a sus clientes una mejor atención.

Este es el primer préstamo de Anais con MFP y está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro para pagar sus cuotas a tiempo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable y siempre está al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en el grupo. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos para implementar mejor su librería.
texts.en:
Anais, 19, is a hard-working, sincere young woman, who lives with her parents and is willing to work hard in order to improve her quality of life. Anais has set up a bookstore, which has become one of the main ones in her neighborhood, because she has many customers who know they will be able to find everything they need. In addition, the bookstore also offers photocopying services, which gives her an edge over her competitors. She rises very early every day to tend to her shop because she knows that, the more hours she's open, the higher her earnings will be. On the other hand, what she likes best about her work is chatting with her customers; this makes the long work days go by pleasantly. She has been in this line of work for 3 years and she considers the most difficult part of it to be having to stay open until very late at night. In time, she would like to improve her shop's infrastructure so that she can offer better customer service. This is her first loan with MFP and she is willing to work very hard to make her payments on time. She is a very responsible member of her communal bank and she's always well aware of the agreements reached by the group. The 1000 new soles requested will be used to buy more stock items for her bookstore.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock inventory for her bookstore.

loans.name: Ricardo Francisco

texts.es: En el 2000 don Ricardo Francisco R. empezó a comercializar tomate en cuyo negocio le va muy bien ya que es una de las frutas más vendidas. El tiene siente hijos los cuales debes en cuando le ayudan en el negocio ya que trabajan.
texts.en:
Ricardo Francisco R. began selling tomatoes in 2000. He does well in this business because tomatoes are one of the best-selling fruits. He has 7 children who sometimes help him with his business because they all work elsewhere.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tomatoes.

loans.name: Luis Eduardo

texts.es:
Luis Eduardo C. P. tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero, y vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.
El socio es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Yagui Grande.  Son 38 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura y la crianza de animales menores.
Luis se dedica a la agricultura cómo su principal fuente económica.  Produce el maíz, papas, y habas.  Con el último crédito que sacó Luis, lo utilizó para siembras de papas y cultivo de maíz.  Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas.
Lo que le gusta más de su pueblo es que tiene una comunidad muy unida.  También a Luis le gusta colaborar para organizar fiestas y crecer animales en el campo.  Sus sueños para el futuro son comprar su propio terreno para construir una casa y reparar la calidad de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Luis Eduardo C. P. is 22 years old and single. He lives in the canton of San Miguel, in Bolívar Province. He is a member of the Yagui Grande communal bank. There are 38 members in total, the majority of whom work in agriculture and raise small animals. Luis works in agriculture for his primary income. He cultivates corn, potatoes, and broad beans. Luis used his last loan to plant potatoes and corn. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of agricultural inputs. What he likes about his town is that it is a very unified community. Luis also likes working to organize celebrations and to raise animals in the countryside. His dream for the future is to buy his own land so he can build a house and improve his family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy agricultural inputs

loans.name: Hayde

texts.es:
Hayde, de 20 años, es una joven muy sencilla y alegre, vive en la casa de sus familiares y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida.
La venta de hoja de coca es el negocio al que se dedica, esta actividad le ha sido muy rentable y le ha dado los ingresos necesarios para mantenerse por sí sola. Ella compra estas hojas al por mayor, ya que le sale más barato, para luego venderlas en el pequeño puesto que tiene en la puerta de la casa donde vive alquilada.
Por otro lado, lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que le da tiempo para dedicarse a sus estudios, lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto de venta, ya que le es muy estresante. 
Hayde espera que con el tiempo su negocio crezca y le brinde mejores ingresos económicos.

Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP y desea ser muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, en su banco comunal es muy querida por sus compañeras debido a la alegría que pone en el grupo. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más bolsas de hoja de coca, ya que últimamente está teniendo mayor demanda.
texts.en:
Hayde, 20, is a cheerful and very unassuming young woman who lives with her family; what she most desires is to improve her quality of life. She sells coca leaf. This has been a very profitable business and has produced enough profits for her to be able to support herself. She buys the leaves at wholesale, because it's less expensive that way, and then she sells them at a small stand she has at her rented house. On the other hand, what she likes best about her work is that it gives her time to dedicate to her studies. She has been in this line of work for 2 years and considers the most difficult part of it to be having to stay at her sales stand all day because this is very stressful. Hayde hopes that her business will grow in time and produce higher income. This is her 4th loan with MFP and she wants to be very punctual with her payments. Her fellow communal bank members like her very much because of the cheerfulness she brings to the group. The 1000 new soles requested will be used to buy more bags of coca leaves since demand has been growing lately.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags of coca leaves.

loans.name: Yudith

texts.es:
Yudith, de 22 años, es una muchacha muy trabajadora y persistente, vive en una habitación alquilada y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida.
Aunque todavía es muy joven sabe lo que es trabajar durante todo el día para tener el dinero necesario para pagar sus estudios. Ella es dueña de una tienda de licores muy conocida, ya que es una de las principales del distrito donde vive, pero también ofrece bebidas gaseosas y algunas golosinas. Su carisma y la alegría que posee han hecho que sus clientes la prefieran, es por eso que lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es atender a sus clientes. 
Lleva 3 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que despertarse a altas horas de la noche cuando algún cliente le toca la puerta, ya que la demanda de sus productos es muy buena. 
Para más adelante, espera tener el dinero necesario para implementar una tienda de abarrotes, con la cual pueda mejorar sus ingresos económicos.

Este es el cuarto préstamo de Yudith con MFP, en sus anteriores créditos no ha tenido problemas de pago. Ella es la socia más alegre de su banco comunal y eso les transmite a todas sus compañeras. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más licores para implementar mejor el stock de su tienda.
texts.en:
Yudith, 22, is a hard-working, persistent young woman. She lives in a rented room and what she desires most is to get ahead in life. Although she is still very young, she knows what it is to work all day to have enough money available to pay for her schooling. She owns a very well-known liquor store that is one of the main ones in the district where she lives. She also stocks soft-drinks and some sweets. Her cheerfulness and charisma make her a favorite among customers and what she likes best about her work is taking care of her customers. She has been in this line of work for 3 years and considers the most difficult part of it to be having to get up at all hours of the night to take care of a customer who comes knocking at her door since demand for her products is very good. For later on, she hopes to have enough money to set up a grocery store so that her earnings will improve. This is Yudith's 4th loan with MFP and she has had no repayment problems with her previous loans. She is the most cheerful member of her communal bank and she transmits her good mood to her fellow members. The 1000 new soles requested will be used to buy more liquor to improve her store's stock.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy liquor to stock her store.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 64 años, vive junto a su esposo en su casa propia.
DesD. hace 20 años tiene una tienda que implementó en su misma vivienda. Allí comercializa diariamente productos comestibles D. primera necesidad; como arroz, azúcar, leche, entre otros, los cuales son los más demandados por su comunidad. Para mantener su bodega bien surtida, cada semana se abastece comprando en el mercado mayorista y otras ocasiones sus proveedores le llevan los productos hasta su tienda, como es en el caso D. las bebidas gaseosas. 
En estos largos años, su negocio ha permanecido estable, sin mayores problemas y proporcionándole buenas ganancias, es por esa razón que seguirá trabajando en su tienda por muchos más años, menciona.

Este es su 13avo crédito con MFP, ella es una D. las socias más antiguas D. su banco comunal, por lo que ha desarrollado actitudes D. cooperación y solidaridad aprendidas durante su permanencia en su grupo. El dinero que ahora solicita lo utilizará en la compra D. mercadería en abarrotes para su tienda.
texts.en:
María, 64, lives with her husband in her own home. She has had a grocery store set up in her home for the last 20 years. She's open daily and stocks basic food items like: sugar, rice, milk, among others, which are the most requested in her community. To keep her store well-stocked, she buys from wholesalers weekly; other times some product distributors, like soft-drinks, come to her store to deliver goods. Throughout these long years her business has been stable with no major problems and producing good profits. For this reason, she will continue to work in her store for many more years, she says. This is her 13th loan with MFP. She is among the longest-standing members of her communal bank and has developed cooperative and solidarity skills during her membership. The funds requested now will be used to buy stock items for her grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock inventory items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es: El señor Rubén Espinoza García es un cliente distinguido de nuestra Institución ya que todos sus pagos se registraron puntuales, anteriormente se le había otorgado un crédito para la mejora de su vivienda,crédito que fue pagado con puntualidad, nuevamente esta tramitando el y su esposa la señora María de la Luz Hernández para iniciar la construcción de un cuarto en un terreno que acaban  de adquirir.
texts.en:
Señor Rubén Espinoza García is a distinguished client at our institution since all his payments have been made on time. In the past, he had been granted a loan to improve his house, a loan that was paid on time. Now he and his wife, Señora María de la Luz Hernández, are negotiating to begin the construction of a room on a piece of land that they have just acquired.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Begin construction of a room

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia tiene 37 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia.
Desde hace 11 años se dedica a las labores agrícolas y ganaderas. Tiene en su establo con vacas, toros y ovejas; además siembra maíz, papa y alfalfa, la que le sirve para alimentar a sus animales. Para Silvia, sus mejores ingresos económicos se los brinda la venta de alfalfa, por lo que ha intensificado su producción. Ella corta todas las mañanas este pasto para alimentar a sus animales y posteriormente distribuirlo a sus clientes. Y por la rentabilidad de este negocio está planeando adquirir más extensiones de terreno para sembrar alfalfa.

Este es su 9no crédito con MFP y está muy contenta de ser parte de su banco comunal, donde viene participado activamente. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará sacos de abono para sembrar más alfalfa, y también un becerro para criarlo y luego venderlo.
texts.en:
Silvia, 37, lives with her husband and two children in her own home. For the last 11 years she has been a farmer and has raised cattle. The has cows, bulls and sheep and she grows corn, potato and alfalfa, which serves as feed for her animals. For Silvia, her best earner is alfalfa sales, so she has increased its production. She harvests this grass daily to feed her animals and then distribute to her customers. Because of the high profitability of this business, she is planning to acquire more land to grow alfalfa. This is her 9th loan with MFP and she is happy to be part of a communal bank where she is an active participant. The funds requested now will be used to buy sacks of natural fertilizer to plant more alfalfa as well as to buy a calf to raise for subsequent sale.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy natural fertilizer.

loans.name: Catherine Group

texts.en:
Catherine S. is leader of a group of five borrowers called 'Catherine Group'. She is thirty-five years old and is married with three children. She could not continue her education from 7th grade due to poverty.

Catherine’s business is the sale of children's clothes. She sells at Waterside Market, a big market located in downtown Monrovia. She has been running this business for twenty years and hopes to own a store in the near future.

Catherine started her business by selling palm oil but she lost everything during the war when heavy fighting broke out in Monrovia on April 6, 1996. She attracts customers by talking to them in a good manner. Catherine needs this loan to purchase more goods (children's clothes) for resale. She dreams of educating her children and building a home for her family.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Catherine is the one holding the sign. Bandu T. is in the inset at lower left.

About LEAP:

The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more children's clothes for resale

loans.name: Soap Sellers Group

texts.en:
These are members of the 'Soap Sellers' group. They are small-scale entrepreneurs in Makeni City, who want a loan of Le 2,000,000 (or SLL 500,000 each) to enable them to improve their businesses. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs will be accessing from SMT/Kiva. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses; sales will thus improve and so also will their sales-to-profit-margin. With a larger profit at their disposal, they will be able to better look after themselves and their children.

The leader of this group is Fatmata K. on the left. Fatmata was born in Makeni. She is now age thirty-two, married with three children. Her husband is a businessman too, and her children are attending school. Fatmata produces and sells soap and has been in the soap business for four years now. With her share of the loan, she will buy soap producing materials like palm oil, caustic soda and plastic bowls.

loans.use: Buy working materials like palm oil, caustic soda, plastic bowls, etc.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: El señor Julio Rincón M. es casado con la señora Placida Salto ellos son clientes distinguidos y recomendados por nuestra Institución ya que anteriormente obtuvieron un crédito con nosotros para el mejoramiento de su hogar colocando una barda,mejora que se realizo, nuevamente están tramitando para la instalación de las protecciones de su hogar, ya que requieren de mayor seguridad por el horario de su trabajo ya que son personas muy trabajadoras y responsables, así ellos estarán mas tranquilos cuando salgan de casa.
texts.en:
Señor Julio Rincón M. is married; his wife is Señora Placida Salto. They are distinguished clients, recommended by our institution, because in the past they obtained a loan from us to improve their home by building a wall, an improvement that was completed. Now they are negotiating for the installation of protection on the doors and windows of their home, since they require better security because of their work schedule. They are very hard-working and responsible people, so their minds will be more at ease when they leave the house.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install protection on the doors and windows of his house

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: La señora Marta realiza venta de ropa, el crédito lo va a utilizar para la compra de ropa colegial de la cual ella ofrece de casa en casa, la señora dice que el crédito le ha beneficiado ya que con estos ha podido mejorar su calidad de vida, el negocio lo empezó con ahorros propios, antes de esta actividad ella era ama de casa y se decidió empezar con el negocio para tener un mejor ingreso para su familia es madre soltera  y tiene 4 niños en edad escolar.
texts.en:
Marta sells clothing. She will use the funds to buy school clothes to then sell door-to-door. She states that the funds have been beneficial to her because they have allowed her to improve her quality of life. She began her business with her own savings. Prior to this, she was a housewife and decided to start a business so that she could have better income for her family. She is a single mother of 4 school-age children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pants, skirts, blouses, school shirts, shoes.

loans.name: Alhamdulilia Group

texts.en:
These are members of the 'Alhamdulilai' Group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve their standard of living.

Fatu B. in the middle of the photo is the leader of this group. Fatu was born in Makeni. She is age 55, married with 4 children all of whom are now grown-ups and on their own. Her husband is a tailor. For 20 years now, Fatu has been selling rice and 'gari' (food made out of ground cassava). She also sells fried cakes, meat, dried fish, and bread. With her share of the loan, she will buy rice, 'gari', and frying (cooking) material – oil, fish, onions, meat, etc.

loans.use: Buy rice, 'gari', and frying (cooking) material – oil, fish, onions, meat, etc.

loans.name: Hector Alcides

texts.es:
Héctor P. de 51 años de edad, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento, es soltero con 2 hijos ya mayores de edad.

Héctor empezó vendiendo sacos de arroz a vecinos de su sector después de reunir un capital de dinero pudo poner una pequeña tienda vendiendo arroz, azúcar, dulces.

Hace 15 años realiza esta actividad el trabaja desde las 07h00 hasta las 21h00 todos los días, Héctor distribuye arroz y trabaja en su tienda. Uno de los inconvenientes que tiene es la delincuencia del sector donde vive.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar embutidos, arroz, bebidas para tener más variedad en su tienda. En el futuro quiere comprar una camioneta para poder transportar mejor el arroz y demás víveres.
texts.en:
Héctor P., 51, lives in a periurban area in Paraíso de Guayaquil. His house is cement, he's single and has 2 adult children. Héctor started selling sacks of rice to his neighbors. Once he had saved up a bit of money he was able to set up a small store selling rice, sugar, candies. He has been in this line of work for 15 years and he's open from 7am until 9pm every day. Héctor distributes rice and works in his store. One of the inconveniences he has to face is the high level of delinquency in his area. The funds will be used to buy cured meats, rice and beverages in order to have a more varied stock in his store. In the future, he would like to buy a van to transport the rice and other supplies more easily.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice, beverages, cured meats.

loans.name: Mayling Group

texts.es: El grupo Mayling está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras que desde tempranas horas se encuentran el mercado ofertando su producto. Estas son Juana Isabel P., Damaris del Carmen A. P. y Antonia de los Santos
texts.en: The Mayling group is made up of three, hard-working women, who can be found in the market selling their products from very early in the morning on.  They are: Juana Isabel P., Damaris del Carmen A. P. and Antonia de los Santos

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es: La señora Ernestina E. G., tiene 45 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida en el Barrio Laureles Sur, uno de los principales problemas del barrio es que se registra un alto índice de delincuencia que amenaza con la seguridad de sus hijos y la de ellos, el señor trabaja como contratista y le apoya económicamente en los gastos del hogar, ellos tiene 2 hijos lo cual en los tiempos libres trabajan para el papá, con el esfuerzo de su esposo ella administra su pequeño negocio el cual es una venta de carne y los domingos venden sopa , los planes a corto plazo serian el terminar de hacer la casa y levantar una segunda planta para tener una mejor comodidad, el negocio quiere ampliarlo e instalar una carnicería más surtida,  para esto solicitó de un préstamo que le permita diversificar su oferta y de esta forma generar mayores ingresos que beneficien económicamente a la familia.
texts.en:
Ernestina E. G., 45, lives with her life partner in the Barrio Laureles Sur neighborhood. One of the neighborhood's main problem is that it has a high crime rate that threatens their own and their children's security. Her husband works as a contractor and he contributes to household expenses. They have two children, who work with their father in their spare time. With her husband's efforts, she runs their small business in which they sell meat; on Sundays they sell soup. Their short-term goal is to finish their home and to build a second story on it so that they can be more comfortable. The business needs to be enlarged and she wants to install a better stocked butcher shop. For this, she has requested financing that will allow her to diversify her stock offerings so that earnings will increase thereby being of economic improvement for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy meats.

loans.name: Teodoro Jose

texts.es: El señor Teodoro tiene el negocio de explotación de mina de poma en el cual desde horas muy tempranas se levanta a realizar su actividad diaria que es el sacar poca el cual un trabajo duro ya que es a la intemperie, el crédito lo ocupara para la compra de herramientas para el trabajo ya que es muy pesado y estos se deterioran rápido además le han ayudado a mejorar su calidad de vida ya que el empezó a trabajarle a un vecino y ahora es dueño de su propia mina.
texts.en:
Teodoro operates a business mining pumice stone. He gets up early every day to make a meager living doing difficult work in harsh conditions. He will use the loan to buy new tools because tools quickly fall apart due to the difficult work. They have also helped him improve his quality of life: he began by working for his neighbor, and he is now the owner of his own mine.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tools for mining business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy textile materials

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice K. is a 48-year-old mother of seven who owns and operates a small general store. Her husband, Andrew, works at the Firestone rubber plantation near their residence in Harbel, Margibi County, Liberia. Harbel is about 40 miles from Monrovia, the nation's capital. From 1991 to 1992, during Liberia's civil war, Alice was forced to take refuge in neighboring Guinea to the north. She is thankful that since her return her business has allowed her to accomplish so much. Alice started her general store about 12 years ago. She has found success in her enterprise, which helps pay for her children's school fees. Her seven daughters are all in school; the oldest is 25 and studies computer science at university and the youngest is four years old. Alice and her husband have also been able to afford to buy land and build a house for their family. Alice intends to use the proceeds of this loan to buy more inventory for her store such as sugar, flour, rice, batteries, candles, soap, and laundry detergent. About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, this non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy sugar, flour, rice, batteries, candles, soap, and laundry detergent as inventory for a general store

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.es:
Zenaida tiene 41 años, vive con su esposo y sus 5 hijos en su casa propia.
Desde hace 12 años tiene una fábrica de ladrillos donde labora junto a su esposo. Ellos trabajan todos los días, sin descanso, para lograr producir ladrillos en la cantidad y calidad necesaria para su comercialización. Su trabajo es muy duro, ya que requiere de mucho esfuerzo físico y tiempo, puesto que cada madrugada su esposo se levanta para calentar el horno y por la mañana  Zenaida ayuda en la preparación de la masa de arcilla que es depositada en los moldes y dejada secar en el sol por un día entero; una vez secos se depositan en el horno para cocinarse durante 24 horas.

Este es su 13avo crédito con MFP, ella se siente muy comprometida con su banco comunal, por lo que seguirá trabajando por la unidad de su grupo. El dinero que ahora solicita lo utilizará en la compra de los materiales necesarios para la fabricación de ladrillos; como arena fina, aserrín y cal.
texts.en:
Zenaida, 41, lives with her husband and their 5 children in a house they own. For 12 years, she has had a brick factory where she and her husband work together. They work every day, with little rest, to make enough good bricks to sell. The work is very hard because it requires a lot of physical effort and many long hours. Her husband gets up early every morning to fire a kiln while Zenaida helps make the clay mix that is then molded and left to dry in the sun all day. Once the mix dries, they put the bricks in the kiln to bake for 24 hours.

This is Zenaida's 13th MFP loan. She is very committed to her community bank and she will continue working to strengthen the group. The loan that she is applying for now will be used to buy the materials necessary to make bricks: sand, wood chips and lime.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for brick manufacturing business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fresh fish

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.es: La señora Dionisia G. T., tiene 40 años de edad y vive en el barrio 31 de Diciembre ella está casada pero se encuentra en proceso de divorcio, debido a la indiferencia de su esposo ante las finanzas del hogar, ella tiene un hijo de 14 años que estudia la escuela secundaria, dentro de los mayores anhelos de la señora está el poder ofrecerle a su hijo la educación profesional que le permita que sea un ciudadano que aporte a nuestra sociedad. Ella es comerciante de equipos electrónicos y  vende productos de belleza, hace poco tuvo la desdicha de perder a su  madre y esto perjudicó su estabilidad económica. Ella solicita este crédito con el objetivo de pagar los boletos aéreos para viajar a Panamá y comprar productos de belleza que los pueda vender a buen precio permitiendo una buena economía a corto plazo.
texts.en:
Sra. Dionisia G. T., 40, lives in the 31 de Diciembre neighborhood. She is married, but she's divorcing her husband because of his failure to support the family. She has a 14-year old son who is in high school. One of this woman's greatest hopes is that she can provide her son with a good education so that he can eventually contribute something important to society. Dionisia operates an electronic equipment business and sells beauty products. She recently lost her mother, sadly, a loss that has made her economic situation worse. She is applying for this loan to pay for a trip to Panama so that she can buy beauty products that she will then be able to sell at a good price.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: Jovel

texts.es:
Jovel O. Q., tiene la edad de 57 años, es casado, y tiene 3 hijos, que son su mayor prioridad. Los hijos tienen 46,32,y 6 años respectivamente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de novillas, para la siembra de pasto y la reconstrucción de cercas. El está seguro de que puede darle un buen mantenimiento y así mejorar su condición económica.La idea de sembrar pasto es para mantener vacas de leche, que en estos momentos ya tiene tres, pero quiere ir creciendo poco a poco.Es la segunda vez que se financea con  FUDECOSUR, el manifiesta que el comité de crédito le ha ayudado mucho, ya que por la ayuda ha logrado sacar adelante los diferentes proyectos que se ha planteado, además que está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron.
El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica, además de que desea tener una pequeña lechería para aumentar sus ingresos.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Jovel O. Quiros, 57, is married and has 3 children. The children, 46-, 32- and 6-years old, respectively, are the most important people in the world to him. He wants the loan to buy heifers, plant grass and rebuild fences. He is sure that the investment will provide him a good living and improve his economic condition. He wants to plant grass to support his three milk cows, a number that he hopes to increase over time. This is his second FUDECOSUR loan and he says that the the loan committee has helped him a lot. Their help has allowed him to proceed with various projects that he had planned and he is very satisfied with the funds that he has received. In the future, he hopes to provide his family with a better quality of life and more economic stability. He would also like to have a small creamery to increase his income. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy heifers and supplies for livestock business.

loans.name: Petty Traders Association Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the 'Petty Traders Association' group. As their name suggests, they are small-scale businesspeople in the city of Makeni in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of SLL 1,600,000 (or SLL 800,000 each) to enable them to boost their businesses.

Jariatu K. is the leader of this group of two. The 37-year-old was born in one of the several villages that make up Sanda, in northern Sierra Leone. She is married with 5 children. Two of her children are in primary school and 3 are in secondary school. Jariatu makes and sells soap and has been in this business for 5 years now. With this loan, she will expand her business by buying working materials like oil, caustic soda, powder and so on.

loans.use: Buy working materials like oil, caustic soda, powder and so on

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es: Maria Del Rosario tiene 61 años, ella se dedica a la venta de leche por lo que dio inicio hace más de 8 años por su familia, ya que anteriormente era su familia quien se hacía cargo del negocio más tarde Maria aprendió lo necesario con esta actividad. Ella se levanta todos los días muy temprano por lo que tiene que ordeñar la vaca, y que en ese tiempo no tenía la capacidad de ofertar muchos productos para la variedad de clientes que poseía. Ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra de pastos, vacunas entre otras cosas. Su deseo es terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Maria Del Rosario, 61, makes a living selling milk, a business that was started by her family more than 8 years ago. The business was started by others in her family but Maria learned the ropes later and now she knows everything she needs to know to run it. She has to get up very early every morning to milk the cow. She didn't have the ability to provide many products for the range of customers that she had. She is applying for this loan to buy feed and vaccines, among other things. Her greatest hope is to one day finish building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Carlos Stalin

texts.es:
Carlos C. de 28 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, tiene solo luz y agua como servicios básicos, su esposa es ama de casa tienen 1 hijo de un año tres meses. 

El hermano de Carlos antes era dueño de una panadería pero cuando se caso hubo una mala administración y quebró el negocio. Carlo le pidió que le vendiera los implementos que tenia para hacer pan y que le enseñara. 

Carlos ahora tiene una panadería con una mini tienda, trabaja todos los días. El deja preparado el pan desde la noche para solo hornear la masa del pan en la mañana. El vende el pan de sal a $ 0.05, el de sal $ 0.05 y el litro de leche $ 0.70. Uno de los inconvenientes que tiene en la panadería es la delincuencia. El aproximado de su clientela es de 40 personas al día.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar harina, manteca, mantequilla, levadura para tener más variedad de panes. En el futuro quiere tener otra panadería y poner productos comestibles.
texts.en:
Carlos C., 28, lives in a periurban area somewhere along the Guayaquil beltway. He only has electricity and running water. His wife is a housewife and they have a son, who is a year and three months old. Carlos' brother used to own a bakery but, when he got married, there was an inefficient administration, and it went broke. Carlos asked him to sell him the bread-making equipment that he had and he asked him to teach him baking. Carlos now has a bakery with a minimart attached; he works every day. He prepares the dough the night before so that in the morning all he has to do is bake it. He sells salt bread for $0.05 and a liter of milk at $0.70. One of the obstacles he faces is that the bakery is in a high-crime area. He sees about 40 customers per day. With the funds he will buy flour, lard, butter and yeast so that he can produce a larger variety of bread. In the future he would like to have another bakery and to stock food items.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Flour, lard, yeast.

loans.name: Maria Francisca

texts.es: La señora Maria Francisca es trabajadora de la alcaldía de Nindirí donde tiene de laborar 13 años, ella el crédito lo invertirá en los gasto de pago en la universidad la señora ha trabajado con CEPRODEL desde hace tres años en donde dice que los créditos le han beneficiado ya que ha mejorado su vivienda y su calidad de vida, también para subsidiar los gastos de la Universidad de su hija ya que esta sacando su monografía, ella es madre soltera con dos hijas también tiene a su cargo a su mama de 80 años.
texts.en:
Maria Francisca is employed by the Nindirí mayor's office. She has been working there for 13 years. She will use the funds to pay for university costs. She has collaborated with CEPRODEL for the last three years and she states that the funds have been helpful in that they have allowed her to make home improvements and have improved her quality of life as well as pay for her daughter's university expenses since she is finishing her thesis. She is a single mother of two daughters; she also is responsible for her 80-year-old mother.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for university expenses.

loans.name: Adilia

texts.es: La señora Adilia E. M., tiene 35 años de edad, ella con su compañero de vida habitan en el Barrio Laureles Sur, el señor trabaja en un taller de enderezado y pintura apoyando de manera económica a los gastos del hogar, ellos tienen 4 hijos los cuales todos estudian la escuela primaria estando bajo su dominio, ella trabaja como domestica, dentro de las principales necesidades que presenta la familia está el realizar mejoras en el hogar que le resguarde la seguridad de la familia y la comodidad de todos es por esto que solicita este crédito para la construcción de una pared lateral al lado este de su casa de aproximadamente 2 metros para ir poco a poco avanzando en las remodelaciones del hogar.
texts.en:
Adilia E. M., 35, lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood with her life partner. He works in an auto detailing shop and contributes to the household expenses. They have four children, all of whom are in elementary school and under her care. She works as a domestic. One of the family's main needs is to improve the security and comfort of their home. She is requesting funding to build a 2-meters-high wall on the east side of her house in order to continue forward with home improvements step by step.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall.

loans.name: Carolina Del Socorro

texts.es:
En el municipio de Nagarote del departamento de León, la señora Carolina A. se ha dedicado con gran esfuerzo a laborar a diario con el propósito de llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación y así beneficiar a sus dos hijos ya que ella es madre soltera y también debe velar por el bienestar de su mamá.

Ella necesita invertir en la compra de útiles escolares y pago de colegio para uno de sus hijos porque este va a iniciar sus estudios en este nuevo año. Por este motivo es que ella está solicitando un crédito para dar lugar a la inversión en los estudios de su hijo para que este llegue a ser un gran profesional.
texts.en:
Carolina A. lives in Nagarote, León department. She works hard every day to earn sustenance for her home and provide for the well-being of her two children. She is a single mother who must also care for her own mother. She needs to get school supplies and pay tuition for one of her sons because he is going to start a new school term. She is requesting funding to pay for his schooling so that he will become a great professional some day.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for her son's schooling.

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
En el municipio de Nagarote en León, la señora Marta Lorena C. se dedica con gran esfuerzo a su actividad de venta de venta de alimentos que son elaborados por ella misma dedicándose al destace de cerdo done vende la carne en su localidad y varios clientes le visitan para realizar sus compras.

Ella actualmente está solicitando un crédito que lo invertirá en la compra de tres cerdos para destace y así continuar con la elaboración y venta de alimentos para lograr siempre la satisfacción de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Marta Lorena C. lives in Nagarote, León department. She sells prepared meals that she makes herself. She butchers pigs and sells the pork in her locality; several customers come to her to buy. She is requesting funding to buy three pigs to butcher so that she can continue making meals to satisfy her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy three pigs to butcher and for meals preparation.

loans.name: Pastora Idalia

texts.es:
La señora Pastora Idalia tiene su propia pulpería en el municipio de Nagarote en León donde vende todo tipo de productos comestibles y a pesar que dicha pulpería no cuenta con las condiciones necesarias como estantes y vitrinas, ella continua esforzándose por mejorar sus condiciones en el negocio.

El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de los productos azúcar, frijoles, aceite, arroz, verduras y pan para ofertarlos en la pulpería. Ella espera confiadamente que su crédito será otorgado y de esta manera contribuirá al desarrollo y mejora de su pulpería.
texts.en:
Pastora Idalia has her own grocery store in Nagarote, León department, where she sells all types of food items, even though the store does not have ideal conditions, like display cases and shelving. She continues to make an effort to improve her business' condition. The funds will be used to buy products like: sugar, beans, cooking oil, vegetables and bread to stock her store. She is confident that the loan will be approved so that she can continue to develop and improve her store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar, beans, cooking oil, rice, vegetables and bread.

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es: Karla Patricia tiene 40 años, ella tiene 2 hijos de 19 y 13 años de edad a su cargo. Su actividad económica es ofrecer el servicio de venta de recarga. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que es una mujer muy responsable y abnegada por lo que siempre está buscando la manera de proporcionar a sus hijos la oportunidad de estudiar, lamentablemente Karla no pudo terminar sus estudios y solamente finalizo el 6 grado de primaria a pesar de estos inconvenientes ella ha logrado salir adelante con este negocio que es su único medio de vida. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de suficientes recargas para su negocio y ofrecer a sus clientes lo que le soliciten. El sueño de ella es agrandar su negocio para obtener más ganancias y ayudarle a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Karla Patricia, 40, has two children, 19 and 13 years of age, under her care. She sells phone card recharging services. She has been in this line of work for 4 years. She is a responsible, self-sacrificing woman who is always looking for ways to provide her children with the opportunity to study. Sadly, Karla wasn't able to finish school; she only completed 6th grade. Despite these inconveniences, she has managed to get along; this business is her only source of income. The funding will be used to buy sufficient recharges to meet the demands of her customers. Her dream is to enlarge her business so that her profits will increase and she will be able to help her children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy phone recharges.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
En el municipio El Viejo en Chinandega el señor Rosario M. se ha destacado por ser maestro de un colegio de la comunidad y siempre busca la manera de mejorar las condiciones de vida de él y de su familia.
Ha tomado la decisión de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda que por mucho tiempo ha estado en condiciones desfavorables pero que ahora mejorará grandemente y es por esta razón que el señor Rosario está solicitando el crédito porque comprará los materiales de construcción para llevar a cabo esta obra y brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida y un techo donde habitar.
texts.en:
In the town of El Viejo in Chinandenga, Sr. Rosario M. has been recognized for his work as a high school teacher in this community. He is always looking for ways to improve the living conditions for him and his family.

Rosario has made the decision to make improvements to his home, which has been in bad condition for quite some time. For this reason, he is requesting a loan in order to buy construction materials needed to make these improvements and provide his family better living conditions and a roof over their heads.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Antonio Isidro

texts.es:
En el municipio El Viejo de Chinandega, el señor Antonio S. se dedica  a la actividad ganadera por medio de la crianza de vacas las que alimenta a diario y después de la crianza procede a la extracción de leche para la venta.
Es un varón muy dedicado a su actividad ganadera y siempre está pendiente del mejoramiento de su familia porque ha llevado el sustento a su casa de habitación. 
El crédito que está solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de vacas paridas para continuar con la crianza y aprovechar la extracción de la leche para su respectiva comercialización.
texts.en:
In the town of El Viejo de Chinandega, Sr. Antonio S. raises livestock. He feeds his cows every day so that they can produce milk for him to sell. Antonio is very dedicated to his animals since he is always dependent on them to maintain his household and improve his family’s condition.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy young milk cows to raise so that he can improve his milk production and sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cows

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es: La señora Reyna Isabel O., tiene 40 años de edad y vive con su compañero de vida en el Barrio Laureles Sur, el señor trabaja como Guarda de Seguridad y es el principal sostén económico de la casa, con ellos vive su hija de 16 años que trabaja como mesera en una cafetería, ellos son una familia humilde pero trabajadora y honrada, la señora Reyna realiza trabajos domésticos en casas particulares, en el barrio donde la familia habita dentro de las mejoras primordiales que se necesitan están el reconstruir la pared del frente de su casa esto le dará mayor seguridad a la familia y le permitirá poco a poco el mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Sra. Reyna Isabel O. is 40 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Laurles Sur. Her live-in partner works as a security guard and is the main breadwinner of their household. They have a 16 year old daughter who works as a waitress at a café. Reyna and her family are modest, hardworking, and honorable people. She performs domestic work at private homes in the neighborhood where she lives.

Reyna’s home is in need of major improvements, including the reconstruction of a wall in front of her house. This will provide greater security for her family and will help them gradually improve their standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Reconstruct a security wall in front of her house

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es: Maria Del Socorro tiene 49 años, esta señora ha logrado aprender muchos negocios y esto le ha proporcionado una amplia experiencia. Su actividad económica es la venta de frijoles cocidos y tamales hace mas de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, y no le fu muy fácil ya que ella no tenía el capital necesario para obtener muchos clientes,  pero esto le ayudo a prender de otros negocio y logro recoger lo suficiente para dedicarse a esto. Actualmente ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra de un quintal de frijoles y tamales ya que en su vecindario es famosa por su venta. Su deseo es establecer una tienda y que su hija finalice sus estudios.
texts.en:
Maria Del Socorro is 49 years old. She has been able to learn many businesses and gain a wealth of experience. Her current business is selling cooked bean and tamales and has been doing this for more than five years. Getting started was not easy since she did not have the capital needed to attract many customers. The knowledge she gained from working in other businesses helped her to persevere.

At the moment, she is requesting a loan in order to buy a quintal (100 kg) of beans and ingredients for making her famous tamales. Maria would like to establish a store and see her daughter finish her studies.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beans & ingredients for making tamales

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es:
Eusebio O. M., tiene la edad de 50 años, es casado, y tiene 4 hijos, que son su mayor prioridad. Los hijos tienen 28,16,15 y 14 años respectivamente. El crédito lo quiere para la una granja de gallinas y para arreglar la porqueriza de los cerdos y comprar dos cerdos más. Con esta inversión el espera poder aumentar sus ingresos para mejorar su situación económica. Es la segunda vez que don Eusebio se financia con FUDECOSUR, el manifiesta que el comité de crédito le ha ayudado mucho y que le brindaron muchas facilidades a la hora de solicitar el crédito. 
El espera que con este proyecto pueda crecer y así pueda en un futuro brindarle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Eusebio O. M. is 50 years old and has four children who are his highest priority. His children are 28, 16, 15, and 14 years old respectively. The loan he is requesting will be used for his chicken farm and also to remodel his pig sty and buy two more pigs.
