With this investment, he hopes to increase his earnings so that he can improve his financial situation. This is the second time Eusebio has received a loan from FUDECOSUR. The loan committee has been a great help and offers different options when applying for a loan.

Eusebio hopes this new project will grow and that in the future he can provide his children with a better quality of life and financial stability.

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Remodel his pig sty, purchase two pigs, and invest in his chicken farm

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar González M., tiene la edad de 22 años, está  soltero, y no tiene hijos, pero su madre y hermano dependen de él. Su madre tiene 60 años y su hermano 23 años. El crédito lo quiere para la siembra de horatlizas y su mantenimiento, además desea sembrar árboles forestales. Tiene un terreno de 3 hectáreas con condiciones óptimas para el desarrollo de estas actividades y con el conocimiento necesario para realizarlas de la mejor manera.El desea a corto plazo tener ingresos con las hortalizas y a mediano plazo con los árboles maderables.
Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le han brindado. Don Oscar  trabaja  desde varios años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Oscar González M. is 22 years old, single, and does not have children. However, his mother and brother are dependent on him. His mother is 60 years old and his brother is 23 years old. The loan he is requesting will be used to plant and maintain a crop of vegetables. He also wants to plant trees. Oscar has three hectares of land that have optimal conditions for pursuing these activities. He also possesses the knowledge that will help bring about the best outcome. The vegetables will provide him with short-term income and the timber from the trees will provide income in the long-term.

This is the first time Oscar has received a loan from FUDECOSUR. He is very happy with the services that have been provided to him. Don Oscar has worked several years in agriculture. He hopes in the future to provide his family with a better quality of life and financial stability. In addition, Oscar hopes to continue growing as a person and as a farmer.

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plant vegetables & trees

loans.name: Lupe

texts.es:
Lupe C. de 43 años, vive en una zona periurbana ubicada en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, tienen casi todos los servicios básicos en su casa, es madre soltera de 5 hijos de 30, 19, 16, 18, 13 años de edad.

Lupe antes tenía un comedor en el mercado del sur de Guayaquil, al cambiarse de casa tubo que terminar con el negocio, al ver que necesitaba un ingreso para su familia decidió comprar un tacho de pescados y comenzó a vender en la esquina de su casa.  

Ahora Lupe trabaja desde las 05h00 todos los días vendiendo la libra de pescados a $ 1.8, la libra de camarones a $ 2.00 y otras tipos de mariscos, tiene un promedio de 30 clientes diarios. Uno de las incomodidades que tiene es que hay muchas personas borrachas por donde vende los mariscos.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar una carpa, camarones, pescados para poder agrandar el negocio. En el futuro quiere comprar un terreno para poder construir su propia casa y poner hay su negocio.
texts.en:
Lupe C. is 43 years old and lives in a periurban district located along the Perimetral Highway in Guayaquil. Her home receives almost all of the basic services. She is a single mother of five children (ages 30, 19, 18, 16, and 13).

Lupe previously owned a diner at the market south of Guayaquil. When she moved into a different house, she had to quit her business. In order to generate an income for her family, she decided to buy enough fish to fill a trash container and began selling them on the street corner outside of her home.

Lupe begins work every day at 5am. She sells fish for $1.80/lb, shrimp for $2.00/lb, and other types of seafood. Lupe serves an average of 30 customers each day. One of the problems she encounters is the number of intoxicated people who loiter near where she sells seafood.

With this loan, Lupe will buy carp, shrimp, and other types of fish in order to expand her business. In the future, she wants to buy land where she can build a house and establish a business there.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seafood to sell

loans.name: Soberana Group

texts.es:
El grupo Soberana está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es María Antonia S. García quien vende dulces tradicionales como cajetas, leche burra, melcocha etc. Ella inicio este negocio para apoyar en los gastos del hogar y la educación de sus cinco hijos de 18, 14, 12, 10 y 3 años respectivamente. 

 Josefa del Carmen P. desde hace más de diez años hace y vende comida y refrescos. Mientras Margarita de los Ángeles M.  en 2003 instalo un pequeño taller de calzado.
texts.en:
The “Soberana” (Sovereign) Group consists of three hardworking women. One of them is María Antonia S. García, who sells traditional sweets such as “cajetas” (a sweet gelatin), “leche burra” (toffee made from milk), “melocha” (molasses candy), etc. She started this business in order to help pay for household expenses and the education of her five children (ages 18, 14, 12, 10, and 3 respectively).

Josefa del Carmen P. has been selling food and beverages for more than ten years. Meanwhile, Margarita de los Ángeles M. has been operating a shoe store since 2003.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Michailo

texts.en:
Michailo is married with one small daughter. He sells various types of men's and women's clothing, such as shoes, slippers and bath robes. Michailo has been in this business for eight years. During this time, he was able to open two business locations and gain a large base of repeat clients. 

Michailo is a hardworking person; he wants to develop his business further. Michailo would like to receive 10,000 UAH to increase his assortment of clothing for sale. He hopes to receive additional income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of inventory

loans.name: Galyna

texts.en: Galyna is divorced with one adult son. She sells women's underwear at one of the markets in Nova Kahovka city. Galyna has been in this business for 10 years. Even though she has many competitors, Galyna just likes her business and clients feel this. Galyna has many repeat clients who buy merchandise from her for themselves as well as for gifts. Galyna would like to borrow 12,200 UAH to increase her inventory. She hopes to receive additional income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To increase the inventory

loans.name: Trinidad De Jesus

texts.es:
El señor Trinidad de Jesús A. T., se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos como cultivo de frijol y maíz, y al manejo de ganado bovino, la razón para la cual utilizara este financiamiento. Es para comprar una vaca parida de raza lechera, este cliente comenzó cultivando granos básicos como frijol y maíz únicamente en épocas de invierno, el trabajo lo hacía y lo continua haciendo con ayuda de su familia, el es casado tiene una esposa y 4 hijos quienes son menores de edad pero si ayudan por ejemplo: la madre cocina en casa y los hijos menores llevan la comida al campo o lugar de trabajo, este cliente todo el tiempo se ha dedicado a esta actividad de trabajo y actualmente continua haciéndolo sembrando frijol y maíz, con esto el espera seguir mejorando su actividad de trabajo y poder llegar a producir más y mejor en sus áreas de cultivos, con el ganado lechero aumentar la cantidad de ganado en su finquita, esto le ayudara a mejorar sus ingresos, produciendo y cosechando un grano básico alimenticio como lo es el grano del frijol y maíz producto muy importante en la dieta de los nicaragüenses y con el ganado lechero obtener y producir más leche la cual también es de consumo importante en nuestra dieta, esto le permitirá alcanzar un mejor nivel de vida más digna.
Don Trinidad de Jesús A. T. ha tenido 8 créditos  desde el año 2004 lleva 6 años de trabajar con Ceprodel.
El impacto y beneficios que ha tenido con los financiamientos  es bastante importante ya que le permitieron mejorar sus actividades de trabajo y también incrementar su hato ganadero lo que le han dado como resultado tener e ir mejorando su nivel de vida teniendo mejores ingresos lo que le ha permitido que sus hijos puedan estudiar y tener mayores oportunidades en sus vidas.
texts.en:
Sr. Trinidad de Jesús A. T. raises cattle and grows beans and corn. He is requesting a loan in order to buy a dairy cow. Trinidad began planting beans and corn only in the winter. He does the planting by himself and his family helps him with the rest of the work. Trinidad is married and has four dependent children who help his wife. For example, while his wife his cooking, the children are responsible for bringing in food from the field. Trinidad has been dedicated to agriculture his entire life and continues to plant crops of beans and corn. He hopes to continue improving in his work so that he can produce a higher quantity of crops that of better quality. In addition, he hopes to increase the number of dairy cattle on his small farm. Staples such as beans, corn, and milk are essential to the Nicaraguan diet and Trinidad hopes that producing more of these goods will help him achieve a better standard of living.

Don Trinidad de Jesus A. T. has been working with CEPRODEL since 2004 and has received eight loans over a six year period. The impact and benefits of these loans have been very important, since they have allowed him to improve his business. The increase in his cattle herd has improved his earnings, which has raised his living standards and provided his children with a chance to study and pursue greater opportunities for their lives.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
En el municipio El Viejo de Chinandega, la señora Elizabeth A. se dedica a su actividad de crianza de ganado que ella misma ha llevado a cabo con el propósito de brindarle las condiciones de vida a su familia que tanto ama.
Ella es una dama que siempre está trabajando en el engorde y alimentación del ganado habiendo adquirido vasta experiencia en esta tarea. Es por esta razón que solicita el crédito en Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito que le permita la compra de novillos para proceder con su engorde y de esta manera sacarles el máximo provecho para continuar en su desarrollo económico.
texts.en:
In the town of El Viejo in Chinandega, Sra. Elizabeth A. raises livestock as way of supporting her family whom she lives dearly. She has always worked on a farm and has vast experience when it comes to feeding and fattening livestock. For this reason, she has requested a loan from CEPRODEL in order to purchase steers for fattening. Elizabeth hopes to gain the maximum benefit from this investment so that she can continue to develop financially.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase steers

loans.name: José Santos

texts.es:
El señor José Santos R. se dedica a la actividad agrícola desde hace trece años y siembra yuca en sus tierras con el propósito de ofertarlas para mejorar las condiciones de vida de él y toda su familia en el municipio de El Viejo en Chinandega.
A diario desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana, el señor José R. inicia el trabajo agrícola velando por el buen crecimiento y desarrollo del cultivo. Actualmente necesita los fertilizantes para continuar con la siembra de la yuca y por esta razón es que solicita el crédito para realizar la compra de los fertilizantes y así continuar en su actividad agrícola y beneficiar a su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. José Santos R. has been farming for 3 years. He grows yucca and sells it in order to improve his and his family’s standard of living in El Viejo municipal in Chinandega. Early every morning, Mr. José R. starts off his agricultural work by watching over the growth and development of the crop. Currently he needs the fertilizers to continue sowing the yucca which is why he is requesting the loan. Once the purchase of the fertilizers is fulfilled he can continue with farming and benefitting his family.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of fertilizer to sow yucca.

loans.name: Galo Wilfrido

texts.es:
Galo Wilfrido G. Q. tiene 24 años, es soltero, y no tiene hijos.  Vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.
El socio es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Yagui Grande.  Son 38 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura y la crianza de animales menores.
Galo trabaja en la agricultura para incrementar la economía de la familia.  Los cultivos que más sobresalen son el maíz y las papas.  En pequeñas proporciones, crece el trigo.  Vende los productos en el mercado de San Miguel.
La cultura principal es el carnaval que se celebra todos los años en febrero.  También, a Galo le gusta el deporte con la comunidad.
Galo solicita el crédito para comprar herramientas para el trabajo del campo.  Su meta es tener una buena actividad económica para la familia.  Los desafíos que enfrenta son los problemas climáticos que afectan a los cultivos.
texts.en:
Galo Wilfrido G. Q. is 24 years old, single, and does not have children. He lives in the canton of San Miguel, in Bolívar Province. He is a member of the Yagui Grande communal bank. There are 38 members in total, the majority of whom work in agriculture and raise small animals. Galo works in agriculture to increase his family’s income. The crops he plants most are corn and potatoes. He also grows small amounts of wheat. He sells his products the San Miguel market. The main cultural event of the year is the “Carnaval” celebration, which is celebrated every year in February. Galo also likes playing sports in the community. Galo is requesting the loan to purchase tools for work in the fields. His goal is to have a good source of income for the family. The difficulties he encounters are problems with the weather, which affect his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tools for work in the fields

loans.name: Geysell Yaneth

texts.es:
La Sra. Geysell Yaneth M. P. es comerciante del Municipio de Condega, ella se dedica a atender su negocio una rosticería ubicada en este mismo municipio. 

Ella solicita un crédito en Ceprodel  con el objetivo de comprar materiales de construcción como es el cemento y hierro para la ampliación de la rosticería ya que esta teniendo muy buena demanda por parte de los consumidores debido a su buena atención y calidad del producto. Ella empezó este negocio  hace 4 años después de salir de la Universidad, empezó con un pequeño local el cual ha ido ampliando con esfuerzo propio, ella empieza sus labores diarias todos los días de 9 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche y casi siempre obtiene la ayuda de su mama.

Ella espera que con la compra del cemento y el hierro complete todos los materiales para poder hacer so construcción y tener mas ampliado su negocio y así tener mejor atención y ganar mas clientela.

Geysell es soltera tiene un hija de edad escolar a quien le financia los gastos escolares, también vive con ella su madre.

Este es el primer crédito que ella solicita, con el que espera tener buenos resultados ya que pos cuenta propia esta muy difícil, de esto depende el éxito de su negocio y así mejorar las condiciones para poder trabajar mejor y alcanzar mejores condiciones para su familia
texts.en:
Geysell Yaneth M. P. is a merchant in the municipality of Condega. She makes a living tending to her rotisserie business, also located in Condega. She is requesting the loan form Kiva partner Ceprodel with the goal of purchasing construction materials such as cement and iron so she can expand her rotisserie since her demand is very high thanks to her good customer service and the quality of her products. Geysell started the business four years ago after leaving the university. She started with a small site that she has been expanding all on her own. She starts her work every day at 9 in the morning and goes until 9 at night and is almost always helped by her mother. Geysell hopes the purchase of the cement and iron completes all the materials she needs to do the construction and make a much bigger business so she can better serve and expand her customer base. Geysell is single and has a school-age daughter, and she provides for her daughter's education. Geysell's mother also lives with her. This is the first loan she has requested, and with it she hopes to have good results since she depends on the success of her business and improving the conditions will help her work better as well as improve the living conditions for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to expand her business

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago A. C. tiene 50 años de edad, su estado civil es casado, y tiene 5 hijos: Valeria de 13 años, Gladys de 11 años, Alex de 9 años, Lenin de 7 años, y Diana de 5 años.  Vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.
El socio es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Yagui Grande.  Son 38 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura y la crianza de animales menores.
Santiago trabaja en la agricultura desde hace algunos años como actividad económica de su familia.  Los cultivos principalmente de la zona son maíz y papas.  También Santiago se dedica a la crianza de animales en pequeña cantidad.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas e insumos agrícolas.  Su sueño para el futuro es mejorar la posición económica de su familia.  Los mayores desafíos que enfrenta son las enfermedades a los hijos y problemas de la producción agrícola lo que bajan los precios.
En su tiempo libre, a Santiago le gusta jugar el deporte en la comunidad y también el carnaval que lo celebran todos los años en febrero, el cual es la unión de la comunidad.
texts.en:
Santiago A. C. is 50 years old. He is married and he has five children: 13 year-old Valeria, 11 year-old Gladys, 9 year-old Alex, 7 year-old Lenin, and 5 year-old Diana. He lives in the canton of San Miguel, in Bolívar Province. He is a member of the Yagui Grande communal bank. There are 38 members in total, the majority of whom work in agriculture and raise small animals. Santiago has been working in agriculture for a few years as an income-generating activity for his family. The main crops in the area where he lives are corn and potatoes. Santiago also raises a small number of animals. He is requesting the loan for the purchase of seeds and agricultural inputs. His dream for the future is to improve his family’s economic position. The greatest difficulties he faces are when his children become ill and also problems related to agricultural production that lower prices. In his free time, Santiago likes to play sports in his community. He also likes the “Carnaval” celebration, which is celebrated every February and brings the community together.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seed and agricultural inputs

loans.name: Eneyda

texts.es:
La Sra. Eneyda P. G. es la Directora de un Centro educativo de secundaria en el Municipio de Condega, ella es Lic. En Ciencias de la Educación, soltera y con un hijo en La universidad el cual esta a cargo de ella.

 Eneyda solicita un crédito en Ceprodel para la compra de materiales de construcción tales como es Zinc para techo y vigas metálicas, con la compra de estos materiales ella pretende mejorar las condiciones del área de estudio de los alumnos.

La idea de este centro de educación empieza con el objetivo de tener su propio trabajo luego que ella renuncia como maestra en un centro educativo estatal y el deseo de tener su propia empresa. Eneyda ha tenido este centro de educación secundaria desde hace 6 años e imparte las clases sabatinas y dominicales desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde.

Ella espera que con la mejora de las condiciones de dicha instalaciones brindar un mejor servicio a sus alumnos y por ende tener mas demanda por brindar un servicio de calidad.

Este es el  crédito numero 8 que Eneyda tiene en Ceprodel en un periodo de 8 años, ella dice que estos créditos le han ayudado positivamente ya que ha podido llevar a cabo varios proyectos que se a propuesto para mejorar su empresa así como el que llevara a cabo una ves desembolsado dicho crédito.
texts.en:
Señora Eneyda P. G. is the director of an education center for middle and high school students in the Condega district. She has a license in science and education. She is single and has one son in the university in her district. Eneyda would like a loan from Ceprodel to buy construction materials like Zinc for roofing and metal studs. With these materials she hopes to improve the study area for her students. The idea behind this education center started when she wanted to be her own manager. She quit her job as a teacher in a state school and started her own business. Eneyda has had this education center for the last 6 years and gives classes on Saturday and Sunday from 8 in the morning until 4 in the afternoon. She hopes that with the improved space she will be able to provide better services to her students and ultimately generate greater demand for her quality services. This is the 8th loan that Eneyda has taken out from Ceprodel over the last 8 years. She says that these loans have helped her complete various projects that have improved her business like the one she plans to do with this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Sierra Visher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Fulgencio

texts.es:
Fulgencio C. P. tiene 46 años de edad, su estado civil es casado, y vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.  Sus hijos son María, Laura, Miguel, Manuel, Carmen, Arrelio, Esteban, y Transito.  La mayor María tiene 20 años y el menor Transito tiene 7 años.
El socio es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Yagui Grande.  Son 38 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura y la crianza de animales menores.
Fulgencio se dedica a la agricultura toda su vida como principal fuente económica de su familia.  Dentro de los cultivos que sobresalen son maíz y papas.  Los vende en la feria del cantón los días jueves.  Solicita el crédito para insumos agrícolas y semillas.  Su esperanza es que pueda comprar su terreno propio para construir una casa para sus hijos.  Su mayor motivo de trabajo es mejorar la calidad de vida para su familia.
Vive en una comunidad tranquila, unida, y responsable.  Les gusta colaborar con todos los miembros.  A la familia le gusta trabajar en el campo.
texts.en:
Fulgencio C. P. is 46 years old and he is married. He lives in the canton of San Miguel, in Bolívar Province. His children are María, Laura, Miguel, Manuel, Carmen, Arrelio, Esteban, and Transito. María is 20 years old and is the oldest, and the youngest, Transito, is 7 years old. He is a member of the Yagui Grande communal bank. There are 38 members in total, the majority of whom work in agriculture and raise small animals. Fulgencio has worked in agriculture as his family’s primary source income for his whole life. The crops he grows most are corn and potatoes. He sells them in the canton’s Thursday market. He is requesting the loan for agricultural inputs and seed. His hope is to be able to buy his own land so he can build a house for his children. His greatest motivation is to improve his family’s quality of life. He lives in a community that is quiet, close-knit, and responsible. He likes to work collaboratively with all of the members. His family likes working in the fields.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For agricultural inputs and seed

loans.name: Grupo Hatarinas Group

texts.es:
GRUPO HATARINAS
El grupo está conformado por 10 socios unidos y solidarios sobre todo personas muy trabajadoras que tienen metas por cumplir. Estas son algunas historias de sus integrantes.
Hace muchos años María del Carmen se dedica al negocio de alquiler de cabinas de internet, negocio que le ayuda a aportar con los gastos en casa pero para ella no es suficiente por lo que además vende café a pedidos que lo compra de una empresa exportadora. Es una socia muy entusiasta por eso ella representa al grupo como presidenta.
Como ella misma dice es una mujer mil oficios Martha  se dedica a diferentes actividades que le permiten apoyar a su familia, con la venta de cervezas y gaseosas ha podido educar a sus hijos, además se levanta muy temprano para vender pan a todos sus vecinos. Paralelamente vende menú en una avenida muy transitada en el centro de lima todo lo hace por el bienestar de su familia.
Hace algunos años Paola empezó a tomar cursos de repostería los cuales los aprovecho al máximo ahora ella puede mantener a su pequeña hija haciendo todo tipo de decoración de tortas y postres a pedidos pero eso no es suficiente ya que sus padres cooperan con ella. El préstamo obtenido lo invertirá en comprar algunos insumos y utensilios que les falta para ampliar su negocio.
Clarisas es madre soltera tiene 3 hijos de las cuales solo 2 están bajo su cuidado, hace mucho tiempo empezó vendiendo golosinas ambulatoriamente eso fue muy difícil para ella ya que tenía que trabajar y cuidar a sus pequeños hijos pero con mucho esfuerzo pudo ahorrar un poco de dinero con el cual aperturo una tienda en su casa que hasta hoy es su único sustento, ella se esfuerza mucho para brindarle lo necesario a sus hijos. EL crédito recibido lo invertirá en la compra de algunos productos para surtir su bodega.
texts.en:
Hatarinas Group This group is made up of 10 united and community-minded members. Above all, they are very hard-working people who have goals to accomplish. These are some of the stories of the members.

For many years Maria del Carmen has been in the business of renting internet booths, a business that helps her with household expenses, but for her was not sufficient. Therefore, in addition, she sells coffee by order, which she buys from an exporter. She is a very enthusiastic member of the group, and she therefore represents the group as president.

As she herself says, Martha is a woman with a thousand jobs. She works at different activities that allow her to support her family. With the sale of beer and soft drinks, she has been able to educate her children. In addition she gets up very early to sell bread to all her neighbors. In parallel, she sells meals on a very busy street in the center of Lima. She does all this for the well-being of her family.

A few years ago Paola began to take courses in pastry-making, which she made use of to the maximum. Now she can support her small daughter doing all types of decoration of cakes and desserts by special order, but this is not sufficient since her parents are helping her. She will invest the loan obtained in buying some supplies and utensils that she is lacking in order to increase her business.

Clarisas is a single mother with 3 children, of whom only 2 are in her care. A long time ago, she began selling candies as a walking vendor. This was very difficult for her since she had to work and take care of her small children, but with much effort she was able to save a little money, with which she opened a store in her house, which up to today is her only means of support. She works hard to offer the necessities to her children. The loan she receives will be invested in the purchase of some products to stock her shop.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products and supplies

loans.name: Homero Gabriel

texts.es:
Homero Gabriel G. Q. tiene 30 años de edad y vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.  Es separado y tiene una hija de 3 meses que se llama Emily Gabriela.
El socio es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Yagui Grande.  Son 38 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura y la crianza de animales menores.
Se dedica a la agricultura toda vida como principal fuente económica de su familia.  Dentro de las cosechas que sobresalen son maíz, papas, trigo.  Vende sus cultivos en la feria del cantón San Miguel los días jueves.  Solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas, semillas, y mano de obra.  Su sueño para el futuro es construir una casa propia para sus hijos.  El desafío principal que enfrenta G. es mejorar la calidad de vida para su familia que tenga un estudio de sus hijos.
Lo que le gusta de su comunidad es que es muy tranquila, unida, y responsable.  A todos los miembros de la familia les gusta trabajar en el campo.  Son atentos y buenos jugadores de voleibol.
texts.en:
Homero Gabriel G. Q. is 30 years old and lives in the canton of San Miguel, in Bolívar Province. He is separated from his wife and has a 3 month old daughter named Emily Gabriela. He is a member of the Yagui Grande communal bank. There are 38 members in total, the majority of whom work in agriculture and raise small animals. He has worked in agriculture his whole life and this is the primary income for his family. The crops he plants most are corn, potatoes, and wheat. He sells his crops in the San Miguel canton market on Thursdays. He is requesting the loan for the purchase of agricultural inputs, seed, and labor. His dream for the future is to build his own house for his children. The greatest difficulties G. confronts are improving his family’s quality of life and making sure his children have an education. What he likes about his community is that it is very quiet, close-knit, and responsible. All the members of his family enjoy working in the fields. They are attentive and good volleyball players.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy agricultural inputs, seed, and labor

loans.name: Enrrique

texts.es:
El señor Enrrique R., tiene una propiedad de 12 manzanas de extensión con diferentes tipos de aéreas para explotación, tiene 4 manzanas que las utiliza para cultivar granos básicos(frijol y maíz), 2 manzanas sembradas de café y 6 manzanas de área apta para el cuido y manejo de ganado, el se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos de consumo como cultivo de frijol y maíz, también a la caficultura,(cultivo de café) las cuales también cultivan y cosecha cada año  la razón para la cual utilizara este financiamiento. Es para comprar insumos agrícolas tales como 4 quintales de abono, 8 quintales de urea y pago de  mano de obra para regulación de sombra. Este cliente comenzó cultivando granos básicos  únicamente en épocas de invierno, el trabajo lo hacía con ayuda de su familia, el es casado tiene una esposa y 5 hijos quienes son mayores  de edad y le ayudaban en las actividades de trabajo en el campo a sembrar y cultivar hasta la cosecha de estos granos , actualmente sus 5 hijo ya están casados y son independientes de esta familia, este cliente todo el tiempo se ha dedicado a esta actividad de trabajo y actualmente continua haciéndolo, con esto el espera seguir mejorando su actividad de trabajo y poder llegar a producir más y mejor en sus áreas de cultivos, esto le ayudara a mejorar sus ingresos, produciendo y cosechando mas y de mejor calidad con el cultivo de café de esta forma el obtendrá una mejor comercialización de este rubro que es uno de los rubros de mayor importancia en los sectores de exportaciones de nuestro país, esto le permitirá mejorar su nivel de vida.
Don Enrrique R., ha tenido 7 créditos  desde el año 2006 lleva 4 años de trabajar con Ceprodel.
El impacto y beneficios que ha tenido con los financiamientos  es bastante importante ya que le permitieron mejorar sus actividades de trabajo lo que le han dado como resultado tener e ir mejorando su nivel de vida teniendo mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Mr. Enrique R. has a property that is 12 Manzanas big (1 Manzana = 1.68 acres) and he uses different areas for different activities: he has 4 Manzanas to plant basic grains (beans and rice), 2 Manzanas have planted coffee, and 6 Manzanas are suitable for cattle. He focuses on planting basic grains for consumption such as beans and corn, but also coffee farming, which he plants and harvests every year; activities for which he will use the loan. He will buy agricultural supplies such as 4 Quintales of fertilizer (1 Quintal = 100 kilograms or about 220 lbs), 8 Quintales of urea (fertilizer used as a source of nitrogen), and to pay for manual labor to manage shade for his crops. He started growing basic grains only in the winter season, and he did the work with his family; he is married and has 5 children who are now adults but used to help him with the farm work to plant and harvest the grains. His 5 children are now married and are living on their own. He has been doing this line of work for a long time and he continues doing it now; with this loan, he hopes to improve his productivity to produce more and better crops, and increase his income at the same time. If he harvests and produces more and better quality coffee, he will be able to better market this product which is one of the most important exporting products in this country; this will allow him to improve his quality of life. Mr. Enrique R. has had 7 loans since 2006 and has worked with Ceprodel for 4 years. The impact and benefits he has received from the loans is very important since they have allowed him to improve his agricultural activities which have resulted in a continued improvement of his quality of life and income.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy agricultural supplies: 8 quintales of urea, 4 quintales of fertilizer, and manual labor.

loans.name: Telmo Hugo

texts.es:
Telmo Hugo G. tiene 65 años y vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.  Su hijo Roberto tiene 29 años.
El socio es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Yagui Grande.  Son 38 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura y la crianza de animales menores.
Su actividad productiva es la agricultura desde hace toda la vida.  Los cultivos principales son el maíz y la papa.  También tiene algunas legumbres para consumo familiar.  Telmo solicita el crédito para invertir en la agricultura en la compra de insumos agrícolas.  Su meta es seguir trabajando para sacar adelante a su familia.  Hay varios retos que Telmo tiene que enfrentar, incluyendo las sequias y la presencia de enfermedades en los cultivos.
En sus ratos libres, juega un poco de deporte con la comunidad y le gusta salir con la familia y dar los estudios a su hijo.
texts.en:
Telmo Hugo G. is 65 years old and he lives in the canton of San Miguel, in Bolívar Province. His son, Roberto, is 29 years old. He is a member of the Yagui Grande communal bank. There are 38 members in total, the majority of whom work in agriculture and raise small animals. Telmo has worked in agriculture all of his life. His main crops are corn and potatoes. He also grows some legumes for family consumption. He is requesting the loan to invest in his agriculture through the purchase of agricultural inputs. His goal is to keep working to help his family get ahead. There are many challenges that Telmo has to confront, including droughts and the presence of crop diseases. In his free time, he plays sports in his community. He also likes to go out with his family and to provide education for his son.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy agricultural inputs

loans.name: Micaela Bastidas Ii Group

texts.es:
MICAELA BASTIDAS II
Organización y responsabilidad es lo que caracteriza a la Alcancía Comunal Micaela Bastidas II Ahora lo conforman 10 socias que cursan el sexto ciclo. 
La Presidenta María  Elena se dedica a rubro de las confecciones hace todo tipo de ropa además de confecciones a medida, vestuarios, forros para muebles y todo lo que le solicitan sus clientes.
Hace muchos años Hellen vende productos de belleza es algo que le gusta hacer aunque ella nos manifiesta que este año no ha tenido muchas ventas en comparación con el año pasado pero eso no la desanima ya que siempre busca las circunstancias para poder ofrecer sus productos  piensa en el bienestar de sus hijos.
La venta de Caldo de gallina y comida al paso por las noches ha ayudado a Demesia a educar y mantener a su familia. Hace varios años acondiciono parte de su casa para hacer su negocio, con mucho esfuerzo logro comprar  ollas y platos para la venta de su comida. Ahora tiene muchos clientes que la esperan, la socia está conforme con el crédito y desea continuar trabajando con EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD.
texts.en:
Organization and responsibility is what characterizes the Micaela Bastidas II Communal Bank. Now there are 10 members and they are in their 6th loan cycle. President María Elena is dedicated to making clothes of all types, including tailored items, uniforms, furniture covers, and whatever else her customers request. For many years, Hellen has sold beauty products. It is something she likes to do, although she tells us that this year she hasn't had as many sales as last year. But this hasn't discouraged her; she is always looking for circumstances that enable her to offer her products. Hellen is thinking of her children's wellbeing. Selling chicken broth and meals in the evenings has helped Demesia to educate and maintain her family. Many years ago, she modified part of her house to accommodate her business. With great effort she managed to buy pots and plates in order to sell her food. Now she has many customers who patronize her place. The member is agreeable to the terms of this loan and wishes to continue working with EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY NEEDED PRODUCTS

loans.name: Pedro Alfonzo

texts.es:
Pedro Alfonzo L. tiene 42 años, su estado civil es casado y separado, y tiene un hijo, Walter, de 10 años de edad.  Vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.
El socio es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Yagui Grande.  Son 38 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura y la crianza de animales menores.
Se dedica a la agricultura desde hace casi toda la vida.  Su caballo le ayuda trabajar en el campo.  Crece papas, maíz, trigo, y habas.  Le hacen falta unas maquinas para el comercio.  Actualmente están en una sequia y Pedro no puede sembrar porque no ha llovido.  Espera que pueda sembrar en breve porque normalmente se siembra en el mes de noviembre o diciembre pero ya estamos en el mes de enero.
Solicita el crédito para abonos y semillas para sembrar.  Sus sueños son tener su terreno propio y que siga estudiando su hijo en el colegio.
Le gusta jugar el voleibol y montar el caballo.
texts.en:
Pedro Alfonzo L. is 42 years old. He is married but separated. He has one son, Walter, who is 10 years old. He lives in the canton of San Miguel, Bolívar Province. He is a member of the Yagui Grande communal bank. There are 38 members in total, the majority of whom work in agriculture and raise small animals. He has been working in agriculture almost his whole life. His horse helps him work in the fields. He grows potatoes, corn, wheat, and broad beans. He needs some machines for this business. His area is currently in a drought, and Pedro can’t plant because it hasn’t rained. He hopes to be able to plant soon because normally planting is done in the month of November or December, and it’s already January. He is requesting the loan for fertilizers and seeds to plant. His dreams are to have his own land and also that his son will continue studying in high school. He likes to play volleyball and ride horses.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es:
Nuestra socia NOEMI, pertenecen al banco comunal “PRO DESARROLLO”, la socia vive en Pisac situado en la provincia de Calca departamento de Cusco, está a 40 minutos de la ciudad, es un pequeño pueblo heredero de unas bellas construcciones incas, aquí lugar obligado de paso para todo aquel turista que visita la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 54 años de edad, ella es casada y tiene 2 hijos independientes y casados, la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio, ella es artesana, compra y vende artesanía, nuestra socia trabaja vendiendo sus productos en el mercado central ubicado en la misma plaza principal de Pisac, Nuestra solicita el préstamo como capital de trabajo, para aumentar sus productos artesanales y poder mejorar sus ventas.

La socia agradece y valora la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio, así mismo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member NOEMI, belongs to the “PRO DESARROLLO” communal bank, she lives in Pisac which is in the Calca province in the Cusco department. She is 40 minutes from the city, it is a small village with some beautiful Inca constructions and is a place that all those tourists that visit the city of Cusco must pass through . Our member is 54 years old, she is married and has 2 independent children who are married. The member alternates her home activities with business. She is an artisan, she buys and sells craftwork and our member sells her products at the central market located in the main Pisac plaza. She is asking for the loan for working capital, to increase her handicraft products and to be able to improve her sales. The member is grateful and values the opportunity provided through these means, she promises to fulfill the repayment of her debt within the specified period.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member requires the loan to stock up on merchandise.
